loans.name: Carlos Samuel

texts.es:
Don Carlos, tiene 37 años de edad, el vive con su  madre, y es padre soltero tiene 2 hijos, Su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería, desde hace más de 10 años, Don Carlos esta. solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: sandalias de mujer, sandalias de varón, cosméticos y otros productos para la venta a sus clientes, el realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante, en algunas comunidades cercanas a Danli, Don Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que su negocio a sido la principal fuente ingresos, El se ha ganado la clientela por su buena manera de atenderlos, con el crédito solicitado que reciba Don Carlos, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y así poder salir adelante, el trabaja  muy duro para contar con el patrimonio familiar
Don Carlos uno de sus sueños es tener una tienda de ropa en el centro de la ciudad.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old. He lives with his mother and is a single parent with two children. For over ten years, his main activity has been selling merchandise.
Carlos is requesting the loan to purchase products such as: women's sandals, men's sandals, cosmetics, and other products to sell to his customers. He is a street salesman, and works in several communities near Danli. 
Carlos is a very hardworking person, since his business has been his main source of income. He has earned his customer base due to the good service he offers.
The requested loan Carlos will receive will contribute to him having a better business, so that he may obtain better income to cover expenses at home, and give his family a better quality of life. This will allow him to get ahead. He works very hard towards having a family estate.
One of Carlos' dreams is to have a clothing shop downtown. 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to purchase women's sandals, men's sandals, cosmetics, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Arelis Johana

texts.es:
La Joven Arelis, es una persona  muy  trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, Ella vive con sus 2 hijos. en el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y  tiene más de 4 años de tener el negocio de pulpería.
Arelis el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  maíz, leña, cal, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, confites, manteca, harina, arroz y lácteos de esta manera  incrementar mas  sus ventas. Con el préstamo  espera  incrementar  sus  ventas  y  así atender mejor a sus  clientes y a si tener  mejores  ingresos  para  tener  mejor forma de  vida.
Arelis sus sueños es poder darles a sus 2 hijos una mejor educación ya que los  tiene de corta edad y le gustaría que su negocio creciera.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Young Arelis is a very hard-working person, and she is dedicated to her business. She lives with her two children in the Choluteca department in the south of Honduras. She has had a general store for over four years.
Arelis will invest this loan in the purchase of corn, firewood, lime, pop, sugar, coffee, bread, sweets, candy, butter, flour, rice, and dairy products. This will increase her sales. She hopes that this loan will increase her sales so that she can better serve her customers and increase her income in order to have better living conditions.
Her dream is to be able to give her two children a better education, since they are young, and she would like for her business to grow.

Choluteca,  Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, pop, sugar, coffee, bread, sweats, candy, butter, flour, rice, and dairy products for her business.

loans.name: Yehuda

texts.en:
Yehuda is a 35-year-old man and is married to Meriyati, a 34-year-old lady. They are blessed with two children, namely: Norince, 13, who is attending the fifth grade of elementary school, and Angga, 2. 

Yehuda has a furniture business. He initiated the business in 2008. Yehuda used to work in a furniture store for years. While working in the furniture store he learnt a lot about furniture. He then resigned from his job. With the money he saved Yehuda initiated his own furniture business, which produces house furnishings like cupboards, tables, chairs, door leaves, and window & door frames. 

Yehuda currently gets some orders from customers but the limitation of capital restricted his ability to meet the orders. He is therefore seeking more money to enable him to meet the orders. Fortunately, he got information on TLM that provides loans for small businesses. He was interested in joining TLM and submitted a loan application to request a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). He would like to buy more teak to fulfill his customer's order.

loans.use: to purchase more teak wood

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana es una  persona  muy  trabajadora, dedicada  a su negocio,  vive con   su esposo y una hija. En el departamento de Choluteca  en  el  sur de  Honduras. Doña Damiana tiene más de 2 años de dedicarse a hacer y vender tortillas.
El préstamo lo invertirá en  la compra de maíz, leña y cal. Y de esta manera  incrementar más sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Damiana espera tener  mejores  ingresos para tener mejor calidad de  vida. Sus sueños es poder terminar de pagar su vivienda y darle una mejor forma de  vida a su hija con una buena educación.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Damiana is a very hardworking person who is dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and one daughter in the department of Choluteca, in southern Honduras. Damiana has been making and selling tortillas for over two years.
She will invest the loan in the purchase of corn, firewood, and lime, so that her sales may increase and she may provide a better service to her customers.
Damiana hopes to improve her income so that she may have a better quality of life. Her dreams are being able to finish paying off her home and giving her daughter a better way of life with a good education.
Choluteca, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 31 años, es casada con 02 hijos pequeños, sus hijos aun están en la escuela, es por ellos que trabaja para así colaborar con algunos gastos de la casa de esa manera  apoya a su esposo, ella forma parte del grupo “MUJERES FORJADORAS”  se siente feliz porque sus préstamos han sido de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Kelly empezó vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo, después añadió la venta de calzado, su trabajo le ha permitido tener buenos ingresos y manejar su  margen de ganancia según sus ventas, también le permite estar pendiente de sus hijos y no descuidarlos, gracias a su negocio puede brindarle a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida, su actual préstamo lo utilizara para la compra calzado y productos de belleza, el día de las madres esta cerca y es una buena oportunidad para las ventas, espera aprovechar esas celebraciones para hacer buenas ventas.
*Kelly es la 7ma (paradas) viste polo fuccia con rayas.
texts.en:
Kelly is 31 years old, married, and has two small children who are still in school.  She works for them so that she can contribute towards some of the household expenses and thereby support her husband.  Kelly is a member of the 'Mujeres Forjadores' group.  She feels happy because her loans have been very helpful for her business.  Kelly started out selling beauty products through a catalog and then started selling footwear as well.  Her work has allowed her to make good income and manage her profit margin in accordance with her sales.  It has also allowed her to look out for her children and not neglect them because her business enables her to provide her children with a better education and better quality of life.  She will use her current loan to buy footwear and beauty products.  Mother's Day is approaching and it represents a good opportunity for making sales.  She hopes to make the most of these celebrations to enjoy good sales.

* In the photo, Kelly is the seventh lady from the left.  She is standing up and wearing a striped, fuchsia-colored top.

loans.use: to buy footwear and beauty products

loans.name: Lucy Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Santa Marianita, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Lucy, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ambos mayores de de edad uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es maestro cerrajero. 

Ella es enfermera auxiliar y se dedica a realizar cuidados particulares a una persona de tercera edad, pero también es sus tiempos libres se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, edredones y toallas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta una vez que culminan sus trabajos de enfermería, ella se va  visitara a sus clientes quienes le realizan pedidos los cuales deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace 10 años y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sabanas, edredones y toallas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años  y le gusta porque gracias a esto pudo ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante en sus estudios, con las ganancias de su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Santa Marianita community bank meet in Santa Marianita neighborhood, in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round with both domestic and foreign tourists.  The city is home to one of the most important ports in the country, and America.  It is situated on the Pacific coast.

This is where Lucy lives.  Lucy is 52 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have two children who are both adults.  One of them still lives at home.  Lucy's husband is a master locksmith.

Lucy is a nursing assistant and she provides personal care for an elderly person.  However, in her free time she also sells products.  She sells sheets, comforters and towels door to door once she has finished her nursing work.  She goes to visit her customers who make orders with her.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment weekly.  She has been in this line of work for 10 years and started her business with her first loan from her community bank.

Lucy will use this loan to buy sheets, comforters and towels.  She has been a member of her community bank for ten years and she likes it because the profits from her business have enabled her to help her children make progress in their studies.

Lucy's dream is to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters and towels

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por el Sector de San Pedro en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, por su gran belleza arquitectónica fue nombrada en Diciembre de  1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural, su cultura y tradiciones aun mantenida por su gente.

La Señora María tiene 61 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un mercado de la ciudad, este trabajo lo desempeña hace 50 años iniciándose en el negocio desde muy joven siguiendo el ejemplo de su mamá, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.ç

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para continuar en el negocio.
 
Su meta es tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the Sociedad 12 de Abril communal bank. She lives in the San Pedro sector of the city of Cuenca, an area with a cold climate. Due to its beautiful architecture, this area was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in December 1999. The area has a rich natural heritage, and its culture and traditions are kept alive by its people.
María is 61. She is a single mother of two grown children who are both married and live independently. She lives in her own home.
María sells fruits and vegetables in a market in the city. She has been doing this for 50 years; she started working when she was very young, following her mother's example. She works every day of the week without a fixed schedule.
This is her third loan with this communal bank. Maria will invest her loan in the purchase of fruits and vegetables in order to continue with her business.
Her goal is to have a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nancy Viviana

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por un hermoso  sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, por su gran belleza arquitectónica fue nombrada en Diciembre de  1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural, su cultura y tradiciones aun mantenida por su gente.

La Señora Nancy tiene 23 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio de mariscos actividad que la viene desempeñando desde hace 2 años, labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mariscos.

Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Señora Nancy is a member of the Sociedad 12 de Abril communal bank. She lives in a beautiful sector of Cuenca city which has a cold climate. In December 1999, this area was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site due to the beauty of its architecture. The area has a rich natural heritage, and its culture and traditions are kept alive by its people.
Nancy is 23 and a single mother of two children ages 3 and 5. Her eldest daughter attends a school in the city. Nancy owns their home.
Nancy has been selling shellfish for two years. She works Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.
This is her first loan with the communal bank. She was invited to participate by a friend. This loan will be invested in the purchase of shellfish.
Nancy's goal is to have her own vehicle.

loans.use: to buy shellfish.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, por su gran belleza arquitectónica fue nombrada en Diciembre de  1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural, su cultura y tradiciones aun mantenida por su gente.

Doña Ana tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 25 y 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija está estudiando en una colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio familiar, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. Ana nos comenta que ella y su familia se encuentran muy bien en su salud y agradece a Dios por ello. Nuestra socia se dedica a la atención de su tienda, actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 26 años, este negocio le ha permitido ayudar a la solvencia de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de varios productos para crecer en el negocio, en el pago de dicho crédito no tuvo dificultad ya que realizó los pagos en  la fecha indicada. Este nuevo crédito también es para comprar víveres para surtir mas tienda. La banca comunal le gusta por la rapidez de los créditos mismos que les benefician para el crecimiento de sus negocios.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the '12 de Abril' community bank.  She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city.  Owing to its great architectural beauty, it was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  It has great natural riches and its culture and traditions are kept alive by its people.

Ana is 48 years old, married, and has three children who are 26, 25 and 16 years old.  Her two eldest children are married and independent and her youngest daughter is attending high school in the city.  Her husband helps her in the family business.  They own the house in which they live, having obtained it through their joint work.

Ana tells us that she and her family are  enjoying very good health and she thanks God for this.  Ana's business is serving in her store.  She has been in this business for 26 years.  It has allowed her to help towards the financial solvency of her household and has enabled her to provide for her family.

Ana invested the money from her previous loan in buying various products in order to grow her business.  She did not experience any difficulties in making her loan repayments and made them on time.  She will, once again, use this new loan to buy food products with which to stock her store.  Ana likes her community bank for the speed with which loans are issued.  The loans help the group's members to grow their businesses.

Ana's dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Julianus

texts.en:
Julianus is a 35-year-old man and is married to a 35-year-old lady, Cornelia. They have been blessed with a nine-year-old boy, Ludowikus, who is attending the third grade of elementary school. 

Julianus generates money for his family by providing repair services; he travels a lot around his place to another to repair cars, machines, etc.

Besides providing repair service, Julianus also runs transportation business using a minivan. At the moment, he cannot generate money from the minivan as he needs to replace the equipment inside the minivan. Therefore he needs a loan of 4,500,000 Rupiah (IDR); this loan will enable him to replace equipment in the car, i.e., tape, speaker, and new seats.

loans.use: to purchase car equipment i.e. tape, speaker, and new seats.

loans.name: Yohanis

texts.en:
Yohanis is a 46-year-old man; he is single and lives with his parents. Yohanis feels that he has big responsibility to look after his family whether in meeting their daily needs or in providing education for his nephews and nieces. To make money, Yohanis runs a cattle fattening business and supplies wood to a furniture business. 

Yohanis has been engaged in the business for many years. He has built relationships with the furniture business' owner by providing teak wood once every month. He also has customers who regularly buy cattle from him. 

Yohanis is thinking to improve his income by re-initiating a pig breeding business that he used to run. To implement his plan, Yohanis is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to 8,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). This loan will enable him to repair the used cage and purchase four more piglets.

loans.use: to repair the used cage and purchase four more piglets

loans.name: Ronal

texts.en:
Ronal, 31 years old, is a single man. He lives with his mother and brothers. He used to be unemployed but his uncle entrusted him with two used minivans to be used as an income source. Ronal then started working as a minivan driver and has employed one more assistant to drive the second vehicle. The assistance from his uncle really helps him in meeting his and his family's needs. 

Unfortunately, Ronal cannot afford to produce more income recently as one of his minivans is broken. Ronal wants to repair it soon but the limitation of capital has prevented him from doing so. Therefore, Ronal is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on new spare parts and replace a damaged tire.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts and replace a damaged tire

loans.name: Trancito

texts.es:
La Señora. Trancito es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de clima frió, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos y cuenta con una gran belleza natural, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, amable, gentil y cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Trancito tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 29, 27, 26 y 19 años de edad, uno de sus hijos trabajan para solventar sus gastos personales, sus otros dos hijos estudian en una universidad de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Transito tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, allí vende limpiones, repuestos para licuadoras y varios artículos más, actividad que la desempeña hace 25 años y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Nuestra socia se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de limpiones, repuestos de licuadoras, etc. para seguir creciendo.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Trancito is a member of the communal bank Estrellitas. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate and since December of 1999 is a World Heritage Site. The city is bathed by four rivers and displays great natural beauty. Its people are very warmhearted, kind, gentle, and courteous. They maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples.
 
Trancito is 50 years old, married, and from her marriage she conceived four children, who are of ages 29, 27, 26 and 19. One of her children works to cover his personal expenses, her other two attend university in the city, and her youngest is going to a school in the city. Her husband works as a merchant. They do not own a home, so they rent. 

Transito owns a market stall in the city, where she sells dusters, spare parts for blenders, and several other items. She has been doing this for 25 years and she works from Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.

Our member has been with the communal bank for two years and is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of dusters, spare parts for blenders, etc. to continue growing.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase dusters, spare parts for blenders, etc.

loans.name: Melyanse

texts.en:
Melyanse is a 31-year-old lady married to Yufri, a 32-year-old man. They have been blessed with an eight-year-old boy, Junadi, who is attending the second grade of elementary school. 

Melyanse's husband is working as a driver, but the income from being a driver cannot fully cover their daily needs. This situation led them to initiate a repair shop business in 2001 using their own capital. The business is usually open from 8 am to 8 pm. From the business, Melyanse could produce more income and she is now able to employ two assistants. Besides serving customers by repairing tires, inflating tires, and so on, Melyanse also has cigarettes for sale. 

Melyanse is thinking of improving her business by adding more spare parts and lubricants to sell. Because of the lack of capital, Melyanse requested a loan of 4,500,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM to buy the things needed for her business improvement.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as tires, spark plugs, and lubricating oil

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan Ramón tiene 25 años, es soltero, el, su mama y su tres hermanos residen en la comunidad de Corral Viejo, San Esteban. Desde hace 8 años el se dedica a la cría de cerdos, el inicio comprando un cerdo que lo adquirió de los ahorros de su trabajo y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su porqueriza, también hace trabajos de albañilería, ya que Juan es el proveedor de alimento en su hogar,  como hermano mayor ha apoyado a su madre para poder sacar adelante a sus hermanos, es una familia luchadora y unida. Algunos de los problemas que Juan enfrenta es la falta de mercado local y no tener un establecimiento adecuado para la cría de cerdos. El préstamo que Juan Ramón esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos. Con la ayuda de este préstamo el podrá mejorar las condiciones de su porqueriza. Una de sus metas es poder tener una porqueriza más grande y con mejores instalaciones físicas para poder comprar más cerdos y que le pueda generar mayores ingresos. Este es el primer financiamiento que tiene con FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Juan Ramón is 25 years old and single.  He lives with his mother and three siblings in Corral Viejo community, in San Esteban.  He has been raising pigs for eight years.  He started out buying a pig that he acquired with some savings from his job and he has gradually been increasing the size of his pigsty.  Juan Ramón also works on construction jobs because he is the food provider for his household.  As the eldest son, he has supported his mother in providing for his siblings.  This is a hard-working and united family.  Some of the problems that Juan faces are a lack of local market and not having a suitable establishment for raising pigs.  He needs the loan that he is requesting to invest in the purchase of pigs.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to improve the conditions of his pigsty.  One of his goals is to have a larger pigsty.  With better installations, he will be able to buy more pigs and thereby make more income.  This is Juan's first loan from FAMA and he expects to make his loan repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Igit

texts.en:
Igit, 33, lives in a small village of Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia. Igit is married and lives with his wife, Sirush, two daughters, ages 8 and 6, and a son, 4. The elder children go to school. Sirush is a housewife. Igit works hard to provide income for the family. His family agricultural business has cows and sheep. Igit produces cheese and sells it in the village to local dairy product retailers. He also sells lambs and grows potatoes on a family-owned plot of land.

Igit has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for his land. He will till the land, fertilize it, and sow potatoes, working hard during the spring. He hopes that the weather conditions are favorable and he will get a good harvest. Profits from the harvest will be used for the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for potato-growing.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Luz Marina runs a carpentry workshop, where she works from 7am to 9pm. She and her spouse create furniture such as tables, chairs, doors and windows, which they then sell in one of the district markets. A loan will help Luz Marina purchase more wood, which is the basic raw material required for her work.

Luz Marina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Ccachimayo," which is located 30 minutes outside of Cusco city in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase wood for her carpentry work.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo, 54, lives in a small village of Terjola District with his wife, Lola, a 26-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and his mother, who is retired. Rezo is a construction worker who works mainly in his district. Along with his main job, Rezo is actively involved in a family agricultural business. The family has six milk cows and six sheep. Rezo produces cheese which he sells in the village to local dairy product retailers. The family also sells lambs.

Rezo requested a loan to purchase construction materials for a cattle shed. His existing cattle shed is old with a broken roof and can’t keep domestic animals in normal conditions. The new building will be wider for more cows and sheep so in the future Rezo will have ability to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a cattle shed.

loans.name: Heroina Monserrate

texts.es:
En el barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Santa Marianita, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Heroína, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es capitán de un barco.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto tener para sus gastos sin depender de nadie se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal, Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, vende también en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando le llega mercadería nueva, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa por catalogo de todo tipo. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The Santa Marianita Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Santa Marianita neighbourhood of the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited frequently by local and international tourists in every season. Manta is one of the most important ports in the country and in South America, located on the shores of the Pacific ocean.
Here we meet Señora Heroína. She is 54, married, and has three grown and independent children. Her husband is a ship's captain.
Heroína is a housewife. In order to make her own income and to be able to cover her expenses without depending on anyone, she sells clothing through a catalogue as well as Yanbal and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works two to three hours a day, three days a week. She sells her products at home; her customers come in when she has new merchandise. She offers her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has done this work for over twelve years and it is going very well for her. Heroína tells us that her most popular products are the perfumes and cosmetics; she says they are very good products.
This loan is for the purchase of perfume, cream, cosmetics, and clothing of all kinds through a catalogue. This is her sixth loan cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because it is easy to make the payments.
Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Erasmo Tomas

texts.es: Erasmo  de oficio agricultor  se dedica a la siembra y crianza de ganado, cerdos, es casado, padre tres hijos. El empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad junto con sus padres los cuales se dedicaban a lo mismo. Lleva 26 años dedicándose a la siembra de maíz, yuca, ajonjolí, sus productos los vende dentro de su misma comunidad. El está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar insumos, pago de mano de obra para sembrar yuca. Pues este préstamo le permitirá darle una mejor asistencia a sus cultivos y sacar una mejor producción. Dentro de sus planes futuros le gustaría comprar vacas y poder producir leche para conseguir otros ingresos y mejorar la finca.
texts.en:
Erasmo, a farmer by trade, works in sowing and raises livestock, pigs.  He is married and the father of three children.  He began to work from a very young age with his parents, who did the same work.  He has worked for 26 years growing corn, yucca, and sesame.  He sells his products in his own community.

He needs a loan to buy supplies and pay for labor to plant yucca.  This loan will allow him to give attention to his crops and get a better output.

Among his future plans he would like to buy cows and be able to produce milk to get other income and improve the farm.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to pay for labor to plant yucca.

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Senderos está formado por 9 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza de su Centro Histórico la que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos y cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar   Nuestras socias son mujeres que se dedican a varias actividades que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Margarita Azucena, tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 20, 11 y 3 años de edad, dos de sus hijos estudian en la Universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. Margaritac Azucena hace 7 meses labora como empleada privada en una distribuidora de helados, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 11 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En temporadas de ingreso a clases vende todo tipo de material didáctico para la realización de manualidades.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo. El niño de la foto es hijo de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The 'Nuevos Senderos' community bank has nine [female] members who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its historic center which led to it being named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  The city is surrounded by four rivers and has beautiful places to visit.  Our members are women who work in different business activities that allow them to cover their household expenses and provide for their families.  They are kind, warm-hearted people who maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

One of the members of this group is Margarita Azucena.  She is 36 years old, married, and has four children who are 21, 20, 11 and 3 years old.  Two of her children are studying at university and her two youngest are attending school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not own their own home but live in rental accommodation.

Margarita Azucena has been working as a private employee at an ice cream wholesalers for seven months.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 11.00am to 6.00pm.  During back-to-school seasons, she sells all kinds of educational materials for making crafts.

Margarita Azucena has been a member of her community bank for one year and she will invest this loan in buying food for her household.  Her dream is to own her own home. 

The small photograph shows a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.  The child in the photo is the son of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy food for her household

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works in her breakfast business selling products such as rice and sugar. She also prepares quinoa, oatmeal, chocolate and maca with milk. She works as a street vendor from 8.00 am until 6.00 pm. Through this business she is getting her children ahead in life. Her dream is to have a place for her breakfast business. A loan will help Victoria buy wholesale ingredients to prepare breakfasts, such as bread, milk, quinoa and maca.

Victoria is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank “Solidaridad-Ccachimayo,” which is located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients to prepare breakfasts, such as bread, milk, quinoa and maca.

loans.name: Nora Maria

texts.es: Doña Nora tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, ella junto a sus hijos viven en la comunidad de Uluapa, Manto. Doña Nora desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotería, ella comenzó vendiendo en su casa de habitación productos de uso domestico y poco a poco a hecho crecer su pulpería, el horario de trabajo es desde las 7:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm, sus hijos le ayudan en algunas ocasiones atender la pulpería cuando tiene que salir a comprar mas mercadería para la venta. Una de las ventajas es que no tiene mucha competencia y que obtiene muy buenas ventas. El problema por el que tiene que enfrentar doña Nora es que algunas veces los clientes le van a comprar producto que no tiene y que no ha comprado por la falta de dinero. El préstamo que doña Nora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, carnes, jugos, manteca, refrescos, churros, verduras, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este préstamo ella podrá surtir su negocio y por lo tanto tendrá mayores ventas y ganancias. Una de sus metas es hacer crecer su pulpería y que sea la mejor en su comunidad. Tiene 2 ciclos de ser cliente en FAMA y es una cliente que ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en: Doña Nora is 40. She is a single mother of three and lives with her children in the community of Uluapa, Manto. For 20 years she has sold groceries; she started off selling home products from her house, and little by little she built up her store. Her work day starts at 7:00 am and ends at 8:00 pm. Sometimes her children help her with the store when she has to go out to buy more products for sale. One of her advantages is the lack of competition; she has very good sales. One problem that she has to confront is that sometimes customers want to buy products that she does not have and does not have the money to purchase. She will invest this loan in the purchase of products such as: rice, sugar, meat, juice, butter, pop, churros, vegetables, and other items. With this loan, Nora will be able to stock her business and therefore have better sales and better earnings. One of her goals is for her store to expand and become even better. She has been a FAMA client for two cycles, and has always payed off her quotas punctually.

loans.use: to buy general grocery items.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa has a business selling cheese. She purchases the cheese from local producers near her hometown and then brings it to Macchu Picchu to sell. Macchu Picchu is the famous Incan citadel located several hours away from Maria Luisa's hometown. The ancient ruins attract many tourists throughout the year, ensuring that Maria Luisa will be able to find customers in the busy community that has sprung up around the area. A loan will help Maria Luisa purchase more cheese at wholesale prices.

Maria Luisa is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank “Solidaridad-Ccachimayo,” which is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale prices.

loans.name: César

texts.es:
César es un hombre de 34 años de edad, estado civil casado, con 01 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y su hijo. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Wiracocha Valle de los Incas distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 200 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla César  es la agricultura. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años aproximadamente,  es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, donde cuenta con 2.20 has de terreno agrícola en donde tiene sembrado mango y limón en fase de producción; y complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (caprinos, porcinos y aves de corral), los cual al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 4,000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de mango, está inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
César is 34 years old, married, and has one child in his care.  He lives in his own home together with his wife and son.  His home is located in the small village of Wiracocha, Valley of the Incas, Tambogrande district and it receives electricity.  His is a small community of approximately 200 families.  

César's business is agriculture.  He has been in this line of work for approximately eight years which means that he knows it like the back of his hand.  He has 2.20 hectares of farmland where he currently has mangoes and lemons growing.  In addition, he also raises livestock (goats, pigs and farmyard birds).  When they reach an appropriate weight and size, he sells them in the local market.  This makes him additional income.

César is requesting a loan for 4,000 soles to invest in buying nutritionally-balanced feed for his livestock and also fertilizers for his mango crop.  This investment will enable him to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for his livestock and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza  es una mujer de 61 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío La Salina distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 150 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Esperanza  es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino, caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 25 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente su cónyuge se dedica a ala agricultura donde cuenta con 2.0 ha de terreno agrícola que tienen instalado limón, mango y cacao en producción viene cosechando semanalmente lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo que tiene instalado, está inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 61, is married and has two children in her care.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and children.  The house is located in Caserío La Salina in Tambogrande District and it has electricity.  The place is a small community of approximately 150 families.

The activity Esperanza does is raising small farm animals (sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell.  When they reach exact size and weight she sells them in the local market.  She’s been doing this activity for about 25 years and the business is located at home; she learned it from her parents which means she knows the line of work to perfection.  Complementarily, her husband is a farmer; he has 2 hectares of land planted with lemons, mangoes and cocoa beans.  He harvests weekly which allows them to have additional income.

The amount of the requested loan is 1500 new soles that will be used to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and fertilizer for the crops.  This investment will allow her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel continues in her business of selling underwear such as socks, panties, and undershirts. She sells her goods in the streets from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm in Cusco. Through these transactions, she is able to advance her children. Maribel's dream is to have her own shop where she can sell shoes and underwear, including polo shirts and hose. She is requesting this loan to buy underwear at wholesale.

Maribel is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Ccachimayo" located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy underwear at wholesale.

loans.name: Amelia Josefa

texts.es:
En el barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Santa Marianita, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Amelia, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo está jubilado. 

Ella es Arquitecta de profesión y tiene una oficina en el cual presta sus servicio como arquitecta, trabaja en convenio con ingenieros haciéndoles diseños de casas, puentes u obras que estos necesiten, allí en su local también realiza gestiones para personas que quieran acceder a los bonos de vivienda que entrega el Estado para la construcción de vivienda propia, ella trabaja  de lunes a viernes de 8h00 a las 18h00 con la ayuda de una persona que es la encargada de atender a los clientes cuando ella está visitando las obras, tiene más de 25 años con su despacho y siempre tiene trabajo por hacer.

Este crédito es para comprar útiles de oficina, papel para elaborar planos, entre otras cosas. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pagos.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Santa Marianita Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the Santa Marianita neighbourhood of the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited frequently in every season by local and international tourists. Manta is one of the most important ports in the country and in South America, located on the shores of the Pacific.
Here we meet Señora Amelia. She is 56, married, and has four grown and independent children. Her husband is retired.
Amelia is an architect and has her own office. She works collaboratively with engineers, designing homes, bridges and other works. She also helps people who are applying for government home credits for building their own homes. Amelia works Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm with the help of one employee who serves clients when she is visiting work sites. She has been doing this job for over 25 years, and she always has work to do.
This loan is for the purchase of office supplies: paper for making plans and other items. She has been a member of the communal bank for two cycles, and she likes it because it is easy to make payments.
Her goal is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy office supplies, paper for making plans, etc.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Рахимчон женат и на воспитании имеет двоих сыновей. Рахимчон выпускник медицинского училища и работает в сельской больнице, берет дежурства в больнице. В основном в свободное время он занимается выращиванием картофеля, морковь и пшеницы. Он также занимается откормом и продажей скота. Рахимчон запрашивает займ для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений с целью расширения бизнеса. С прибыли он намерен улучшить свои жилищные условия. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Rahimjon is married and raising two sons.  Rahimjon is a graduate of a medical college and works at a village hospital, taking shifts in the hospital.  In his free time, he primarily grows potatoes, carrots and wheat.  He is also involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Rahimjon is requesting this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to expand his business.  He intends to use the profit to improve his living conditions.  He relies on your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has a business producing and selling plaster in a tranquil community located about 30 minutes outside the city of Cusco. Part of the fabrication process requires exposing the raw material to heat over a fire. The heat whitens the plaster and strengthens the properties that make it an ideal construction material. 

Lilian is requesting a loan in order to purchase firewood so that she can produce more plaster. Lilian is a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo" which is located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy firewood to prepare plaster.

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru: Гафур женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В основном он выращивает лук, ячмень и огурцы. Имеет землю в размере 1,4 гектара. Гафур хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль. Гафур запрашивает займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и горюче-смазочных материалов. Гафур надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gafur is married and raising four children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years.  He primarily grows onions, barley and cucumbers.  He has 1.4 hectares of land.  Gafur wants to expand his business in order to make a good profit.  Gafur is requesting this loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricants.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Gilma Nery

texts.es:
Gilma tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 22 años, vive con su familia en un barrio del Municipio de Puerto Cortes.
Doña Gilma realiza una actividad de elaboración y venta de comida. Este negocio lo empezó hace 2 años, viéndose en la necesidad de tener otro ingreso que le ayudara con los gastos del hogar. Dice que siempre le ha gustado la cocina y por eso se motivo a establecerlo ofreciendo a sus clientes variedad de alimentos como Pollos con tajadas, chuletas, almuerzos, baleadas y cenas. Cuenta que este negocio es rentable ya que sus ingresos son a diario y por lo tanto se ha podido mantener con sus ventas.
Para poder seguir elaborando sus comidas ella solicito un préstamo de 12,000 lempiras comprando los insumos que necesita para los alimentos. Y le ayudara a seguir ofreciendo mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su meta es hacer más grande su negocio y así poder atender a sus clientes cómodamente.
texts.en:
Gilma, 58, is married and has a 22 year old daughter.  She lives with her family in a neighborhood in the municipality of Puerto Cortes.

Gilma prepares food to sell.  The business started two years ago because she needed to have another source of income to help with household expenses.  She says she’s always liked to cook so this is why she decided to establish it offering her customers a variety of dishes like: chicken with fried plantain, chops, lunches, stuffed flour tortillas and dinners.  She relates that the business is profitable since she earns daily income and she’s been able to support herself with her sales.

To continue preparing the meals, she asked for a 12000 lempira loan to buy the ingredients she needs for the dishes; it will help her continue to provide good service to her customers.  Her goal is to expand the business to be able to tend to customers comfortably.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Manguito cual esta conformado por  trece mujeres trabajadoras e humildes con deseos de superarse  y mejorar sus vidas.
Son originarias de Pinotepa Nacional para ellas su comunidad  se caracteriza por tener gente trabajadora  y humildes.
Una de las integrantes de este  grupo es la señora Elizabeth de 30 años de edad, ella se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora con sueños por cumplir y con la fuerza y la  capacidad de salir adelante.
Doña Elizabeth  nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo desde hace tres años, también trabaja en un supermercado, ahi tiene varios clientes, pues a sus compañeras de trabajo les ofrece los distintos modelos de zapatos que vende, ademas de ofrecerlo a vecinas y  familiares y sus mismas clientas la recomienda con mas y mas personas y entonces su clientela aumenta y por lo tanto también sus ganancias.
Una de las cosas que mas le gustan de su negocio es que obtiene buenas ganancias  y que vende muy bien su mercancía y sobre todo que hay muchas ofertas para sus clientes  y para ella.
Pero también hay algo que no le gusta de su negocio  ya que en ocasiones se atrasan sus  pedidos y también no les llegan completas y sus clientas se molestan pero siempre tiene calzado extra para mostrárselos y  no se molesten demasiado.
Pidió el crédito para la compra de más  calzado y catálogos para la venta por menudeo  y mayoreo.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudar a todas las mujeres de pueblos con deseos de mejorar sus vidas.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Florencia- se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Yerly Edith- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Magdalena Luz Gregoria– se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Lucia- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Divina- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Francisca- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Blanca Estela- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Isabel Nicolasa - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Abigail- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de catálogos.
María del Carmen- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Luz Belem- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
 Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a todas las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group is called 'El Manguito'.  It is made up of 13 hard-working and humble women who have a desire to do well and improve their lives.

These women are from Pinotepa Nacional.  They say that their community is known for being home to hard-working and humble people.

One of the members of this group is 30-year-old Elizabeth who describes herself as a hard-working person who has dreams to fulfill and the strength and ability to do well in life.

Elizabeth tells us that she has been selling footwear through a catalog for three years.  She also works in a supermarket.  She has several customers there as she offers her work colleagues the different styles of shoes that she sells.  She also sells her products to neighbors and family members.  Her customers recommend her to more and more people and, in this way, both her customer base and her profits increase.

One of the things that Elizabeth most likes about her business is that it makes her good profits and she is very successful in selling her merchandise.  Above all, there are many offers for her customers and herself.  However, there is also something that she does not like about her business.  Sometimes her orders are delayed and sometimes they don't arrive in their entirety.  This bothers her customers.  Nonetheless, she always has extra footwear to show them and they don't get too annoyed.

Elizabeth requested this loan to buy more footwear and catalogs so that she can sell both retail and wholesale.  She is grateful to Fundación Realidad for helping village women who would like to improve their lives.

The other members of this group are:
Florencia - who sells Mexican snack food
Yerly Edith - who sells clothing
Magdalena Luz Gregoria - who sells clothing
Lucia - who sells perfume
Divina - who sells footwear
Francisca - who sells soft drinks
Blanca Estela - who sells groceries
Isabel Nicolasa - who sells Mexican snack food
Abigail - who sells clothing
Guadalupe - who makes catalog sales
María del Carmen - who sells clothing
Luz Belem - who sells clothing

They would like to thank Fundación Realidad for helping all hard-working women.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Segundo Abdon

texts.es:
SEGUNDO ABDON tiene 58 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

SEGUNDO ABDON se dedica al cultivo de cacao y a la cría de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar plantas de cacao, pollos, cerdos.

Con la ayuda del crédito puede adquirir las plantas de cacao que necesita para sembrarlas y producirlas.
El sueño es construir su vivienda.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son a la pérdida de los cultivos por las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte para distraerse.
texts.en:
Segundo Abdon is 58, married, and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Montalvo canton, Los Rios province.
He belongs to the Embarcadero Chico communal bank. The group members work as cultivators of cocoa, oranges, banana, yucca, and plantains, and raise animals.
Segundo Abdon cultivates cocoa and raises hogs. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cocoa plants, chickens, and hogs.
With the help of this loan, he will be able to acquire the cocoa plants that he needs to sow and harvest.
His dream is to build a home.
Among the challenges he has to confront is the loss of crops due to plagues. In his free time he enjoys playing sports for fun.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants, chickens, and hogs.

loans.name: Viviana Fenes

texts.es:
Viviana  es una mujer de 27 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Jesús del Valle distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Viviana es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino, caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente su cónyuge se dedica a ala agricultura donde cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola que tienen instalado limón,  en producción viene cosechando semanalmente lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y realizar construcción de un cuarto para sus hijos, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Viviana is 27 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has three children in her care.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  The house is located in the small village of Jesús del Valle, in Tambogrande district, and has electricity.  This is a small community of approximately 100 families.

Viviana's business is raising and selling livestock (sheep, goats, pigs and farmyard birds).  When they have reached an appropriate size and weight she sells them at the local market.  Viviana has been in this business for approximately five years.  The business is located outside her home and she learned it from her parents which is to say she knows it like the back of her hand.  Viviana's husband works as a farmer.  He has 1.0 hectares of farmland where he grows lemons which he harvests weekly.  This provides additional income.

Viviana is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles which she will use to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her livestock.  She will also build a room for her children which will allow them to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for fattening her animals and to build a room

loans.name: Omon

texts.ru: Более 10 лет Омон занимается выращиванием лука, пшеницы, огурцов. Омон женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Он имеет 1, 5 гектаров поливной земли, обрабатывает её и выращивает сельхозпродукты. Он также занимается скотоводством. Омон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1500 Сомони для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче-смазочных материалов.
texts.en: Omon has been involved in growing onions, wheat and cucumbers for over ten years.  Omon is married and raising three children.  He has 1.5 hectares of irrigated land that he treats and grows agricultural crops on.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  Omon wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 1500 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricants.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.ru: Кахрамон женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Кахрамон трудолюбивый человек, и он любит работать на земле. Имеет 2 гектара поливной и богарной земли, там где выращивает ячмень, дыни и горох. Кахрамон также занимается скотоводством. Его жена занимается домохозяйством и иногда в свободное время помогает мужу по бизнесу. Кахрамон хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян, горюче-смазочных материалов, минеральных удобрений и мелкого рогатого скота.
texts.en: Kahramon is married and raising three children.  Kahramon is a hardworking person, who loves to work on the land.  He has two hectares of irrigated and rain-fed land, where he grows barley, cantaloupe and peas.  Kahramon is also involved in animal husbandry.  His wife is involved in household work and sometimes, in her free time, helps her husband with the business.  Kahramon wants to obtain this loan to buy seeds, fuel and lubricants, mineral fertilizers and small livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.ru: Умарчон добрый и трудолюбивый человек, который женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Он очень старательный человек и день за днем старается улучшить свое благосостояние семьи. Его жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 6 лет он занимается предоставлением услуг такси по местному маршруту. В день обслуживает более 100 пассажиров. Умарчон хотел бы получить займ для покупки двигателя и шин для автомобиля.
texts.en: Umarjon is a kind and hardworking person, who is married and raising five children.  He is a very diligent person and tries to improve his family's welfare day-by-day.  His wife is involved in household work.  Umarjon has been providing taxi services along a local route for over six years.  He services over 100 passengers per day.  Umarjon wants to obtain this loan to buy an engine and tires for his car.

loans.use: to buy an engine and tires for his car

loans.name: Karen Cesia

texts.es: La Sra. Karen tiene 26 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de 6 años, la Sra. Se dedica  ala venta de cosméticos por mayor, ella es  líder  de una empresa de comenticos por catalogo que se vende a  nivel mundial, ella vende los productos visitando distintos domicilios  ofreciendo sus productos, este crédito es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Karen utilizara este préstamo para compra de mercadería por mayor de cosméticos  que se encuentran de promoción, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar inventario, la Sra. Karen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran cantidad de competencia en el mercado, pero aun así ella sigue luchando y trabajando fuerte y utilizara los beneficios surtiendo de diferentes productos de bisutería,  con el tiempo desea tener una tienda propia para ofrecer la variedad de productos y también  diferentes líneas de perfume, la Sra. Karen es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y orgullosa de los logros que consiguió en base a sacrificios.
texts.en:
Karen, 26, is single with a six year old son in her care.  She sells cosmetics at wholesale.  She’s a leader in a firm that sells cosmetics world-wide via catalogue.  She sells the products visiting various homes to offer her products.  

This loan will be her second cycle in the institution.  Karen will use this loan to buy cosmetics merchandise at wholesale that’s on special promotion.  The reason for requesting the loan is to increase her inventory.  

The business challenge Karen faces is the great amount of competition in the market but even so she continues to striving and working hard.  She will use the profits to stock various costume jewelry items. 

In time she’d like to have a store of her own to sell a variety of products as well as various lines of perfume.  Karen is a very hardworking person and feels happy and proud about the achievements she’s attained based on her sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Divino Niño Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Divino Niño esta conformado por once emprendedores que ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en crédito otorgados anteriormente en el cual este grupo ha demostrado ser personas trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante, son emprendedores que se apoyan y juntos salen adelante  se aconsejan en  cada uno de los negocios que tiene. Doña Modesta es  parte de este grupo y su actividad es una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes que la visitan, esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como granos básicos, aceite, jabón, detergente, pan, golosinas entre otros productos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: The Divino Niño Communal Bank is made up of eleven entrepreneurs who have already worked with Fundación León 2000. They have taken out a loan previously, and they proved themselves to be hard-working people with a desire to get ahead. They are entrepreneurs who support each other and get ahead together, advising each other about their businesses. Doña Modesta is a member of this group. She has a general store in her own home. This entrepreneur is requesting a loan for the purchase of products such as basic grains, oil, soap, detergent, bread, candy, and other products that her customers are requesting.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, soap, detergent, bread, candy, and other products that her customers are requesting.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
El nombre de Girasol fue elegido por la Sra. Lety, integrante de este grupo, menciona que se le ocurrió este nombre porque a ella le gusta la flor de girasol y aparte, que se escuchaba bonito.
La Sra. Juany es la presidenta y organizadora del grupo Girasol, ella tiene 49 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos solteros, los cuales ya trabajan a pesar de que tienen entre 19 y 22 años.  La Sra. Juany es dueña de una tiendita llamada “Abarrotes Juany” desde hace 7 años, la cual se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, este crédito le ayudará para surtir más mercancía en este negocio y así poder tener una buena cantidad de inversión en mercancía. También menciona que actualmente cuenta con una máquina copiadora, la cual, actualmente  está descompuesta y tiene el propósito de repararla o comprar una nueva y así poder hacer crecer su tiendita junto con una papelería y mercería.
Un dato interesante de este grupo, es que viven en una misma cuadra y se conocen desde hace mas de 3 años cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
The name "Girasol" ["Sunflower"] was chosen by Sra. Lety, a member of this group. She says that she thought of this name because she likes sunflowers and the name sounded pretty.
Sra. Juany is the Girasol group's president and organizer. She is 49, in a common-law marriage, and has three unmarried children who work, even though they are only between 19 and 22 years old. Juany has owned a grocery store called "Abarrotes Juany" for seven years, located in her own home. This loan will help her to stock more merchandise in order to have a good stock. Juany also says that she currently has a photocopier, which is broken, and she wants to repair it or buy a new one in order to both continue with her grocery store and also have a stationery store.
An interesting fact about this group is that they all live on the same block and have known each other for over three years.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store and open a stationery store.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.en: Justiniano of Santa Maria Moyozingo, Puebla has been a farmer all of his life, and has seen many changes in agricultural practices.  With his small dairy, he produces milk for the local market and also raises sheep, pigs, and chickens.  With organic fertilizer from his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester he will be able to displace the expensive chemical fertilizer he uses on his crops, and with the biogas he will be able to displace the woodfuel and LP gas his family cooks with.  He has four sons that have grown and started farms of their own, and he wants to set an example for them by adopting a new technology that will make his small farm more efficient and sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco and his wife Estela have a small pig farm as well as just over a hectare of corn. His family runs a Tortilleria where you can buy fresh hot tortillas seven days a week in the community of San Juan Tuxco, Puebla. They have to use a lot of LP gas to boil the fresh local corn that they use to make the tortillas, and with the biogas from their Sistema Biobolsa biodigester they will be able to save thousands of pesos each month. The organic fertilizer will also decrease the costs of their corn production while providing a healthier product for the community and a stronger business for themselves.

loans.use: To purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren and his wife Beatriz live with their children in a large peach orchard that was planted by his grandparents in San Lorenzo Chiautzingo, Puebla. They raise rabbits and pigs, and have a small store where they sell their peaches, corn, peppers, beans, and other products they produce on their large plot of irrigated land. 

They are very excited to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because they have seen the results of the organic fertilizer from other local producers and want to save money and reduce contamination by displacing chemical fertilizers. They also plan to install a biogas boiler that will allow the family to enjoy hot showers after a hard day's work.

loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde has a business selling clothing in Izcuchaca, which is about 30 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She sells clothing for adults and children. 

A loan will help Matilde buy wholesale merchandise such as shirts, blouses, and pants. She is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", which is located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shirts, blouses, and pants at wholesale.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando and his wife Barbara run two large flower greenhouses in San Lorenzo Chiautzingo, Puebla. They principally produce roses of a wide variety of colors that they sell throughout Mexico, packaged and prepared. Sometimes they dye white roses in a small workshop for special holidays, and they prepare different gift packages for mothers' day and Valentine's Day. Their greenhouses require high amounts of chemical fertilizer that costs them tens of thousands of pesos each year. The organic fertilizer from their Sistema BioBolsa biodigester will allow them to save lots of money, and will free them from having to work with so many synthetic chemicals. They will use the biogas to cook in their home and to heat water for bathing.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia continues working in the business of selling food. She delivers to people who are building houses and as a street vendor on foot. With this business, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell candy, refreshments, and food. A loan will help Julia purchase more cooking ingredients such as vegetables, potatoes, and rice.

Julia is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank, "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as vegetables, potatoes, and rice.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar and his wife Natalith are a modern family couple in the community of San Felipe Teotlalcingo, Puebla. Natalith has a Masters Degree in Environmental Engineering, and works to develop organic farming systems that reduce the use of commercial fertilizers. They believe that is it their responsibility to advance the use of organics to ensure they leave healthy, sustainable soil for their children. They want the organic fertilizer from a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to support their small organic farm where they raise sheep and produce nopal, tomatoes, corn, beans and other products. They also want to produce less greenhouse gas by using biogas to offset the LP gas they currently use for cooking and heating.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.en: Leonel raises chicken and sheep on a small farm in San Lorenzo Chiautzingo, Puebla. The animal waste from his farm will be treated by his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, and the resulting biogas will be used in the kitchen for cooking and in a boiler for hot water. The organic fertilizer he produces will be used in his greenhouses and orchards where he grows fruit, vegetables and flowers for sale in local markets. Leonel believes this is a good investment for his family because his fertilizer and energy savings will pay off the biodigester in about one year.

loans.use: To purchases a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: El Atardecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Atardecer esta conformado por  siete personas trabajadoras indígenas con deseos  de mejorar su  vida la  de sus  familias y paisanos.
Todos son originarios de Pinotepa  Nacional para ellos su localidad es tierra de gente humilde trabajadora con deseos de mejorar el futuro  de sus hijos.
La vestimenta de la localidad son huipiles  y mandil y en los hombres pantalón de manta.
Una  de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Agustina de  cuarenta y nueve años de edad, ella se caracteriza por ser una persona sencilla, humilde y con deseos de ayudar a su familia.
Doña Tina como mejor la conocen sus compañeros de grupo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de memelitas (mexican snak) de manteca desde hace veinte años, para ella su negocio es uno de los regalos mas lindos que le ha dado Dios, ella trabaja con amor y dedicación.
Nos cuenta  que se levanta muy temprano a las cuatro de la mañana, lava su nixtamal y  muele su masa ya que cuenta con un molino en su casa (el que se muestra en la foto), después  se lleva su manteca y su café  al mercado  y la acompaña su esposo Javier y su hija Guadalupe.
Llegando al mercado prepara su masa pone su masa en una bandeja grande e instala la manteca y sal, después  pone su café en la lumbre mientras ella hace las memelitas de manteca, su hija Guadalupe sale ha vender a los locales que se encuentran dentro del mercado.
A las  seis de la mañana llega una de sus compañeras de trabajo la  señora Audelia  quien le ayuda a hacer las memelitas mientras doña Tina se va a vender las memelitas en la entrada del mercado lleva su bandeja de memelitas y su jarra con café.
Nos dice que disfruta mucho su negocio es algo que quiere mucho y que le ayudado ha darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Ella pidió el crédito para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboración de memelitas como es: dos sacos de azúcar, una  costalilla de café, pues vende café para acompañar las memelitas, diez costalillas de maíz tres tambos de manteca y dos cargas de leños.
Nos comenta que esta muy agradecida con fundación por ayudara todas las personas indígenas y trabajadoras que se ganan el pan con trabajo para dárselo a sus familias.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Alejandrina-quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Ana Laura-quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Guadalupe-quien  se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Zeferina-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Audelia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
German Enrique -quien se dedica a la venta de bisutería.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a todas las mujeres trabajadoras e humildes con deseos de mejor sus vidas.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Atardecer” (Dusk) and it’s composed of seven hardworking, indigenous people who want to improve their own, their families’ and their fellow countrymen’s lives.  All are from Pinotepa Nacional.  For them, their location is a land of humble, hardworking people with the desire of improving their children’s future.  The local style of dress is huipil [traditional embroidered blouse] and apron and the men wear unbleached cotton pants.

One of the group members is Agustina, 49.  She’s noted for being an unassuming, humble person with a desire to help her family.

Doña Tina, as her group members call her, has been making “memelitas de manteca” (Mexican snack) for the last 20 years.  For her, her business is one of the best gifts God has given her; she works with love and dedication.

She tells us that she rises very early, at four in the morning.  She washes her corn and grinds it for masa since she has a mill at home (shown in the photo).  Then, she takes her lard and coffee to the market accompanied by her husband, Javier, and her daughter, Guadalupe.

Arriving at the market she prepares the dough in a large tray and adds the lard and salt.  Then she puts the coffee on the fire while she prepares the memelitas de Manteca.  Her daughter, Guadalupe, goes out to sell them among the stands in the market.

At six in the morning one of her coworkers, Audelia, arrives to help her make the memelitas while Doña Tina heads out to sell them at the entrance to the market; she takes her tray of memelitas and her jug of coffee.

She tells us that she enjoys her business very much; it’s something that she loves very much and that has helped her provide a better life for her family.

She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make the memelitas like: two sacks of sugar, one bag of coffee because she sells coffee to go with the memelitas, ten bags of corn, three tubs of lard and two loads of firewood.

She comments that she’s very grateful to the Fundación for helping all the indigenous people and workers who earn their daily bread with their work to provide for their families.

The other group members are:

Alejandrina-sells food.
Ana Laura-sells soft-drinks.
Guadalupe-sells Mexican fast food snacks.
Zeferina-sells perfume.
Audelia- sells Mexican fast food snacks.
German Enrique –sells costume jewelry.

They thank the Fundación for helping all the humble, hardworking women with the desire to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and coffee.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
