La señora Maria de 36 años  de edad, es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de ella, tres de ellos asisten a la escuela y colegio, tiene casa propia ubicada en una colonia de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
En su casa de habitación tiene un negocio de pulpería en donde atiende a sus clientes que día a día le visitan para comprar sus productos. En esta ocasión Doña María solicita un préstamo de 12,000.00 para compra de granos básicos, frescos, verduras y carnes, con el préstamo a su negocio podrá hacerlo crecer mas y con las utilidades seguirá apoyando a sus hijos y mejorando su vivienda.
El sueño de Doña María es que sus hijos se gradúen y que sean personas de bien en la sociedad  además desea seguir mejorando su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
María, 36, is single and has four dependent children, three of whom attend school.  She has her own house in a development in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  In her house she has a grocery store business where she attends to her customers, who visit her every day to buy her products.

Now María is requesting a loan for 12,000 HNL to buy basic grains, soda, vegetables, and meat.  With the loan to her business she will be able to make it grow more, and with the profits she will continue supporting her children and improving her home.

María's dream is that her children will graduate and be well-to-do people in society.  In addition, she wants to continue improving her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, April 2012

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Oscar Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oscar Oswaldo tiene 49 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

Oscar Oswaldo se dedica al cultivo de cacao y plátano.Solicita el crédito para poder comprar plantas de cacao y naranja, fertilizantes, insecticidas, mata monte.

Con la ayuda del crédito tendría más oportunidad de tener buenos cultivos al hacer la limpieza de la huerta. 

Las compras y ventas de productos las realiza con frecuencia en el Cantón Caluma y Montalvo cada semana. El sueño es mejorar su estilo de vida, comprar un vehículo para realizar las actividades laborales.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son a problemas climáticos y hacer todo lo posible por mantener sus actividades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, jugar bolle y participar en comparsas.
texts.en:
Oscar Oswaldo is 49, married, and has three children. The family lives together in the Montalvo canton, Los Rios province. Oscar Oswaldo is a member of the Embarcadero Chico communal bank. Group members cultivate cocoa, oranges, banana, yucca, and plantains, and also raise animals.
Oscar Oswaldo cultivates cocoa and plantains. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cocoa and orange plants, fertilizers, insecticides, and weed killer.
With the help of this loan, he will have the opportunity to have better crops after tending to the land.
Oscar Oswaldo buys and sells his products in the Caluma and Montalvo cantons every week. His dream is to improve his lifestyle, and to buy a vehicle for the farm labour.
Challenges include the climate and general maintenance of his activities.
In his free time, he enjoys playing sports, playing volley ball and participating in carnivals.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants, orange plants, fertilizers, insecticides, and weed killer.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es: Jesusa de 33 años de edad, conviviente, pertenece a la alcancia comunal "Virgen de las Mercedes, un grupo de 8 integrantes  que se caracterisa por el empeño y la dedicacion en sus negocios con un solo objetivo que es el salir adelante por el bien de sus familias. Jesusa tiene dos hijos aun menores de edad por lo cual se da tiempo entre cuidarlos y poder trabajar en su nuevo negocio de servicio de costura, lleva ya mas de seis meses en este negocio que inicio con su hermana a raiz de que no habian  suficientes ingresos para sustentar su hogar. Aparte de ello trabaja para una empresa en servicio de limpieza, Con este trabajo a podido ayudar a su conviviente en solventar los gastos que cubren pagos como los del colegio de sus hijos, el alquiler de su casa y gastos para su hogar. En el futuro le gustaria tener su propia empresa de alta costura y asi poder tener un trabajo mucho mas estable y con menos horas de trabajo para poder pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos. Con el reciente prestamo lo piensa invertir en comprar de diversas telas, para sus diseños.
texts.en: Jesusa is 33 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, and she belongs to the "Virgen de las Mercedes" communal bank, a group with 8 members. The group is characterized by the hard work and dedication the members put into their businesses, with one single goal: getting ahead for the good of their families. Jesusa has two children who are still minors, so that she divides her time between caring for them and working in her new business providing tailoring services. She has been in this business for more than six months. She started it with her sister because they did not have sufficient income to maintain their household. Apart from this, she works for a company providing cleaning services. With this work, she has been able to help her common-law husband cover the expenses and make payments such as the school fees for their children, the rent on their home, and other expenses of their household. In the future, she would like to have her own company providing high fashion tailoring, and thus she would have much more stable work with fewer working hours, so that she can spend more time with her children. With the recent loan, she is planning to invest in buying a variety of fabrics for her designs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina continues running a business selling “pollipapas” and “salchipapas” (which are made from sausages, chicken, and potatoes). She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor. She has a salchipapas cart where she works from 4:00 p.m. to 12:00 a.m. Through this business, she provides for her children. 

Her dream is to have a stand from which she can sell her salchipapas and pollipapas. She is requesting this loan to buy chicken, potatoes, and cooking gas.

Bernardina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potatoes, and cooking gas.

loans.name: Erasmo Jesus

texts.es: El Sr.  Erasmo  tiene 43 años y es soltero con 1 hijo, el se dedica  a la Fabricación de  ollas de aluminio, el se dedica a esta actividad hace ya 7 años,  sus trabajos los realiza en su taller que está ubicado  en la Zona Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz. Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  Erasmo  va a utilizar  este préstamo de  para la compra de aluminio por mayor por su negocio ya que tiene que fabricar ollas para entregar a distintos puestos de venta en los distintos mercados de la ciudad, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que le hace falta para comprar su materia prima,  Erasmo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar su mercado al interior del País y  utilizara los beneficios invirtiendo en más pedidos para entregar a sus clientes, su deseo para  su negocio es aumentar su producción y de esta manera generar más ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Erasmo is 43 years old and single with one child. He manufactures aluminum pots, a job that he has been doing for 7 years. He does his work in his shop which is located in the Zona Gran Poder of the city of La Paz.

This loan is his second round with the institution. Erasmo will use it to purchase aluminum in bulk for his business, since he needs to make pots to deliver to various sales posts at different markets in the city. The reason for this loan request is to increase his investment capital, which he requires in order to buy his raw material. 

Erasmo faces challenges in his business, such as expanding his market to the interior of the country and using benefits to invest in more orders to deliver to his clients. His hope for his business is to increase his production in order to generate more income, thereby improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy aluminum in bulk for manufacturing pots.

loans.name: Dania María

texts.es:
Dania María es una joven soltera que se dedica a laborar como profesora  desde hace muchos años.
Habita con su querida mamá quien le da lo mejor de si en cuanto a condiciones de vida, ya que es ella la que lleva el pan de cada día a ese hogar gracias a su trabajo.
Tiene siete meses de trabajar con Ceprodel donde en ese período de tiempo le han otorgado dos créditos para mejora de vivienda, la que tiene el objetivo de crearla con todas las condiciones adecuadas para tener un hogar digno donde vivir con su madre.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar  azulejos, cemento, pintura y pago de mano de obra.
Cabe señalar que a pesar de ser joven tiene muchos deseos de superación y visión hacia el futuro de formar un hogar estable.
texts.en:
Dania María is single and has worked as a teacher for many years now.
She lives with her dear mother, to whom she gives everything she needs in terms of quality of life, since thanks to her job, she is the breadwinner.
She's been working with Ceprodel for 7 months and in that time she has received two loans to improve her house; her objective is to renovate her house with adecuate conditions in order to have a home dignified enough to live in with her mother.
She's asking for this new loan to buy tiles, cement, paint and to pay for labor.
It's worthy of note that although Dania is young, she has much desire to get ahead and envisions a future in a stable home.

loans.use: buy tiles, cement, paint and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana continues raising and selling guinea pigs. She sells the guinea pigs in the different markets that take place in the Anta district. Through this business she can help her children get ahead in life. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her guinea pigs. She is requesting the loan to purchase young guinea pigs, which she will keep for about three months before selling. She is happy to have the loan, and she commits to making her loan payments.

Roxana is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", located in the southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy young guinea pigs.

loans.name: Carmen Rocio

texts.es:
CARMEN ROCIO tiene 24 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. 
Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

CARMEN ROCIO se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno. Solicita el crédito para compra de ganado, pollos, cerdos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar el ganado vacuno.

La compra y la venta  de animales lo realizan en el Cantón Caluma cada semana.
El sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mantener el negocio de la cría del ganado vacuno.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es madrugar para estudiar y cuidar a sus hijitos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar junto a sus hijos, los juegos deportivos, fin de año y las festividades de la Virgen de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Carmen Rocio is 24, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Montalvo canton of the Los Rios province.
She belongs to the Embarcadero Chico communal bank, whose members cultivate cocoa, orange, banana, yucca, and plantain, and raise animals.
Carmen Rocio raises and sells cattle. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle, chickens and hogs.
The support of this loan will allow her to increase her herd of cattle.
She buys and sells her animals in the Caluma canton every week.
Her dream is to have her own home and maintain her business raising cattle.
Among the challenges she must confront is having to get up early to study and care for her little children.
In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her children and playing sports. She enjoys New Year's celebrations and the community's religious festivities surrounding the Virgin.

loans.use: to buy cattle, chickens, and hogs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is still running both her restaurant and her other business of selling food on Sundays. Working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., she prepares dishes like roasted guinea pig, roasted chicken and soups, and also sells soft drinks and beer. Thanks to this business she can raise her children.

A loan will help Irene to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as meat, chicken and vegetables. Her dream is to expand the seating area of her restaurant.

Irene is receiving this individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Ccachimayo," located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables for her dishes.

loans.name: La Reforma Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La reforma esta integrado por once mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de superarse y darles una mejor vida a sus familias.
Son originarias de pinotepa  nacional donde la mayoría de sus ciudadanos hablan el idioma mixteco y de vestimenta usan naguas y mandil.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señorita Asunción de  veinte seis años de edad, quien estudio la lic. Enfermería  y se dedica a brindar servicios en una clínica de su comunidad ya que trabaja una semana de noche y una semana de día.
Nos dice que también se dedica a  vender mercancía de abarrotes  ya que  tiene  su pequeña tienda  donde venden lo que es: papel higienico,mayonesa,refrescos,jugos,agua de garrafón,pan,café,azucar y leche.
Le que mas le gusta de su negocio es  que obtiene buenas ganancias y así tener un dinero extra para cualquier emergencia.
Lo que no le gusta de su negocio es dar muchas cosas fiadas por que luego no tiene dinero para comprar  su mercancía.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como son: café, leche, cereal, yogurt, sabritas, jugos, pasta dental, detergente, refrescos y galletas.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudarla y también por ayudar a las madres solteras para que puedan tener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Yaneth Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Socorro- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Antonia- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Minerva- se dedica a la venta de costuras.
Miguelina- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Esther- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Carina- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Guadalupe de Jesús- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de  abarrotes.
Zulma- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Magdalena- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.Le dan las gracias a fundacion  por ayudar a toda las familias pobres.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Reforma” (Reform) and it’s composed of eleven hardworking women who want to improve themselves and their families’ lives.  They are from Pinotepa Nacional where most inhabitants speak the Mixteco language and wear the traditional skirts and aprons.

One of the members of this group is Asunción, 26.  She got her Nursing degree and works providing health services in her community in a clinic.  She works days one week and nights the next.  She tells us that she also sells groceries since she has a small store where she sells such things as: toilet paper, mayonnaise, soft-drinks, juice, bottled water, bread, coffee, sugar and milk.  What she likes best about her business is that she earns profits so has extra money for any emergency.  What she dislikes about it is that she extends credit on lots of things and then doesn’t have money to buy merchandise.

She requested the loan to buy more merchandise for the store like: coffee, milk, cereal, yogurt, Sabritas [brand of snacks], juice, toothpaste, detergent, soft-drinks and cookies.

She thanks the Fundación for helping her and also for helping single mother so that they can have more income and improve their quality of life.

The other group members are:

Yaneth Elizabeth- sells soft-drinks.
Socorro- sells clothes.
Antonia- sells clothes.
Minerva- does sewing.
Miguelina- sells clothes.
Esther- sells soft-drinks.
Carina- sells groceries.
Guadalupe de Jesús- sells groceries.
Zulma- sells shoes.
Magdalena- sells groceries.

They thank the Fundación for helping all the poor families.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana continues running her restaurant, where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Her general hours are now 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. Thanks to this business she is able to get her family ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her restaurant. Juana is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat.

Juana is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", located in the southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia continues working as a seamstress, sewing pants, blouses, and skirts as well as other clothes. She also knits men's, women's, and children's sweaters. Because of this business, she can help her children succeed. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell clothes. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fabric and thread. Silvia is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo," located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Las De La Unidad Group

texts.es:
Las de la Unidad son un grupo solidario que lleva ya 7 ciclos con esta institución. Ellas escogieron este nombre porque así se llama el lugar donde viven. Durante este lapso ellas se han destacado por ser un excelente grupo en donde todas se ayudan unas a otras cuando llegan a tener problemas. 
María Angélica es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella tiene 32 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos, de 16, 14 y 7 años. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortilla de harina. Cuando comenzó sólo ofrecía sus productos a sus amistades cercanas, ahora está saliendo a ofrecer sus tortillas a las tiendas de abarrotes que hay cerca de su colonia. 
María Angélica solicitó este crédito ya que quiere aprovechar el éxito que está teniendo en la venta de sus tortillas. Ella quiere usar este crédito para comprar una tortillera mecánica y una plancha más grande para así poder incrementar sus ventas y satisfacer a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las de la Unidad are a solidarity group that has already been with this institution for 7 cycles. They chose this name because it is the name of the place where they live. During this time they have stood out as an excellent group in which everyone helps each other when they have problems.

María Angélica is one of the women in the group. She is 32 years old and lives in common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has 3 children who are 16, 14 and 7 years old. She makes and sells flour tortillas. When she started she only offered her products to close friends, now she is going out to offer her tortillas to grocery stores near her neighborhood.

María Angélica requested this loan because she wants to take advantage of the success that she is having selling her tortillas. She wants to use this loan to buy a mechanical tortilla press and a larger grill so she can increase her sales and satisfy all of her clients.

loans.use: To buy a mechanical tortilla press and a grill.

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es:
Jorge   es un hombre de 34 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Jesús del Valle distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Jorge es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino, caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente  se dedica a la agricultura donde cuenta con 1.5 ha de terreno agrícola que tienen instalado limón, en producción viene cosechando semanalmente lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y comprar fertilizantes, darle mantenimiento a su cultivo (pagos de jornales), lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Ernesto is 34 years old. He has a common-law partner and 3 children under his charge.  He lives in his own house with hi swife and children. The house is located in the Jesús del Valle hamlet in Tambopata Disctrict and is hooked up to light. There are approximately 100 families in this small community. 

Ernesto is a livestock farmer who raises and sells small animals (sheep, goats, pigs and fowl). When the animals reach exact weight, he sells them in the local market. He’s been a farmer for approximately 6 years. His farm is on the outide of his house and he learned farming from his parents; in other words, he knows his job very well. To complement his animals, he also farms 1.5 hectares of agricultural land where he grows lemons and sows his crop every week, which allows him to have additional income.

He is requesting 3000 soles, which he will invest in buying balanced food for livestock, fertilizer and to carry out maintenance on the crops (to pay day laborers), which will help him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: buy balanced food for livestock, fertilizer and to carry out maintenance on the crops.

loans.name: Alvaro David

texts.es:
El profesor Álvaro David es originario del municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida, es una persona bien responsable que tiene a cargo su hogar conformado por su esposa y sus  hijos a quienes trata de darles lo mejor en educación y llevando el sustento a su hogar.
Es el primer crédito que está solicitando en Ceprodel con el fin de adquirir una motocicleta para agilizar su labor y trasladarse a su centro de trabajo el cual queda en una comarca alejada de dicho municipio por lo que tiene que viajar desde muy temprano para estar a la hora indicada.
Confía en Dios que Ceprodel le apruebe su solicitud ya que le beneficiaría en este aspecto porque con su pequeño salario solo le abarca para comprar la canasta básica y el pago de servicios básicos de su vivienda por lo que no le da para comprar este vehículo que hoy en la actualidad es de gran necesidad.
texts.en:
Professor Álvaro David is from the town of El Sauce where he’s lived his entire life.  He is a very responsible person in charge of a home composed of his wife and children he tries to provide a better education for and to provide sustenance for his home.

This is the first loan he’s asked Ceprodel for.  He wants to buy a motorcycle to make his work easier so that he can get from his house to his place of work which is located in a district far from his town; he has to start his trip very early in order to be at work on time.

He trusts in God that Ceprodel will approve his application because it will benefit him in this aspect because his meager salary is only enough to buy basic staples and to pay his utilities at home and insufficient to buy this vehicle which is of such great need today.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fátima Leonor

texts.es:
Fátima Leonor es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, como toda sauceña lucha cada día por ayudarle a su esposo a llevar el sustento a su hogar así como terminar de construir su vivienda con todas las condiciones adecuadas para brindarles a sus hijos un hogar digno donde vivir y crecer.
Tiene varios años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado seis pequeños créditos todos para ir poquito a poquito construyendo su casita el cual es su mayor sueño.
Este último crédito será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el fin de terminar de construir la cocina para tener más espacio y condiciones para prepararles el alimento a sus hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
Fátima Leonor is from the town of El Sauce.  Like all folks from El Sauce she strives daily to help her husband bring sustenance to their home as well as to finish building their house with all adequate conditions to provide her children with a proper home in which to live and grow.

She’s been working with Ceprodel for several years and she’s been granted six small loans all of which were used to gradually build her house which is her greatest dream.

This latest loan will be used to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheeting aimed at completing building the kitchen to have more space and conditions for preparing meals for  her children and her husband.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia continues her primary business of selling beauty products like lipstick, creams, and perfumes, as well as a smaller business selling cheese. She works independently, working from 8am to 6pm daily. Through her business, Basilia wants to support her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her cheeses. The member is requesting the loan mostly to buy cheese, though she also plans to buy more inventory for her beauty business. 

Basilia is grateful for the loan and would like to assure her lenders that the money is being well spent. She says that it is a great thing to give loans to small business owners like herself, and that she is also able to save money while taking out a loan through her village bank.

Basilia is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy cheese and beauty products such as perfumes, creams, and lipstick from wholesalers.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa continues to dedicate herself to the business of raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens and also has a ranch where she grows corn and potatoes. She sells the produce and animals in different fairs that exist in the district of Chachimayo. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell the animals and her produce. Josefa is requesting a loan to purchase more baby chickens and guinea pigs. She says that since her last loan, her business has gone well and grown a bit. 

Josefa is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy baby chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Santos Remigio

texts.es:
Santos  es un hombre de 32 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Ayar Uchu, distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 150 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino, caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente  se dedica a la agricultura donde cuenta con 2.0 ha de terreno agrícola que tienen instalado limón, en producción viene cosechando semanalmente lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 4500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y comprar de una mototaxi para transportar sus productos y así venderlos a un mejor precio, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is a 32 year old man. He has a spouse and three children in his care.  He lives in his own house with his wife and children located in Caserío Ayar uchu, Tambogrande District.  It has electricity.  The place is a small community of approximately 150 families.

The activity Santos does is raising and selling small farm animals (sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl); when they reach exact size and weight he sells them in the local market.  He’s been in this business for approximately 8 years.  The business is located in his back yard.  He learned it from his parents which means he knows it perfectly.  He also farms.  He has a two hectare parcel of farmland where he’s growing lemons that he harvests weekly producing additional income for him.

The amount of the requested loan is 4500 new soles that he will use to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his livestock and to buy a mototaxi to transport his products so that he can sell them at a better price thus improving his living standard.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en:
Altanbagana is a 34-year-old man who lives with his two children and wife in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He works for a local company while his children attend secondary school and kindergarten. His wife stays at home to look after their children. 

Last year, Altanbagana bought a new plot of land for 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). He planned to build a new house on this plot next spring, so his previous loan was requested to purchase some essential construction materials. Now he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood, bricks and more cement to make his house ready.

Altanbagana is a trusted client of Kiva partner Transcapital Company Ltd.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Intrepidas Group

texts.es:
El nombre del grupo es INTRÉPIDAS es un grupo formado por 9 personas ellas son vecinas y habitan en Monterrey, N.L.
La Sra. Damaris es una integrante del grupo ella tiene 2 años con nosotros, primero pertenecía al grupo chicas de hacienda. Ella tiene 3 hijos, uno 11, una de 9, uno de 3, y su esposo que trabaja de chofer.
La señora Damaris estaba desesperada por que pasaron por una crisis muy fuerte cuando despidieron a su esposo de donde trabajaba. Ella decidió pedirnos un crédito para invertirlo en un negocio, empezó con pacas de ropa para vender en los mercados, después comenzó a surtir perfumes y ahorita su negocio va creciendo. Este crédito ayudará a Damaris a establecer su negocio de novedades y regalos en su casa, para de esa manera no descuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The name of this group is “Intrépidas” (Intrepid Ones).  It’s a group of nine neighbors who live in Monterrey, Nuevo León.

Damaris is one of the group members.  She’s been with us for two years.  She used to belong to the “Chicas de Hacienda” group.  She has three children; an 11-year-old, a 9-year-old and a three-year-old.  Her husband works as a driver.

Damaris was desperate because they went through a grave crisis when her husband was fired from where he worked.  She decided to ask us for a loan to invest in a business and started with some bundles of clothes to sell in the markets.  She then started to stock perfume and now her business is growing.  

This loan will help Damaris to set up a novelty and gifts store at home so that she won’t have to neglect her children’s care.

loans.use: to open a novelty and gift shop at home.

loans.name: Sareub

texts.en:
Sareub is a rural farmer living in a village located in the Thmor Koul district, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is 22 years old and married. She does not have any kids yet. Like other villagers, rice farming is also the only primary source of income for her family and she plants rice on her two hectares of farmland twice per year. Sareub has been in this business for almost five years now. She manages to raise about US $8 per day from her current business, of which she is able to save only around $2 each day. As a farmer, she has challenges of low crop yields and lack of rain to grow her rice.

This is the first loan for Sareub with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, she is going to use the loan to pay for land preparation and to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She strongly hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields so as to earn larger income to set aside some money to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Therese

texts.fr: Therèse est une  femme agée de 52 ans célibataire, mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 33ans.Deux vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place ou elle vend les poissons fumés en détail depuis deux ans déjà. Elle mène à bien son activité mais a souvent un problème de rupture de stock parce qure n'éyant pas assez de moyens, elle est obligée de s'acheter un seul carton à chaque fois, attendre qu'il finisse pour acheter un nouveaux. grace à ce crédit elle pourra s'acheter plus d'un cartons et économiser pour agrandir son activité avec le temps.
texts.en: Therèse is a 52-year old single woman, the mother of four children ranging between 12 and 33. Two of the children are still in school. She is a vendor working at the local market, where she has been retailing smoked fish for two years already. She manages her business well, but often runs out of stock because of insufficient funds. Each time she is forced to buy only a single box and wait until everything is sold before restocking. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy  more than one box and save in order to expand her business eventually.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Sergelenbold

texts.en:
Sergelenbold is a-34-year-old married man who has two children and lives with his family in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He is an operator at local company.

The current small house in which his family lives is so old that it requires renovation, so he is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase some necessary housing materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has been in farming for five years. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand, and it produces mainly fruits, vegetables, and cereals that are sold in the local market. Janet is married with two children, aged eight and one. She also runs a small fuel retail business.

Janet has requested a loan of 90,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank at 60,000 KES and irrigation pipes at 30,000 KES. She plans to expand her farm from the current ten acres to thirty acres. She hopes to earn more income and improve her family's living standards.

Janet says the high costs of labor and insufficient rains are the major challenges of farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and pipes.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es:
María Fabiola tiene 45 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales. 

María Fabiola se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno. Solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, barillas, bloque y poder mejorar la vivienda.
Con la ayuda de crédito podrá realizar el mejoramiento de la vivienda.

Las compras y ventas de productos los realiza con frecuencia en el Cantón Montalvo cada semana. El  sueño es tener una mejor producción de cacao y terminar de construir la vivienda Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo.
 y enfermedades en la cría de animales.
Ella dice no tener tiempo libre para descansar de sus actividades.
texts.en:
María Fabiola, 45, is married with 3 children. She lives in the Montalvo Canton in the Los Rios province. She is a member of the "Ventanilla Rural" (Window on the countryside) of embarcadero Chico and their businesses include the cultivation of cocoa, oranges, guineo (small, short banana), orito (baby banana), yucca, plantain and livestock. 

María Fabiola raises and sells cattle. She is requesting this loan to buy cement, rods and blocks to improve her home.
With this loan she will be able to renovate her home.

Each week she buys and sells product in the Montalvo Canton.

Her dream is to have an imporved production of cocoa and finish the construction of the house. The challenges she faces have to do with the plagues that affect the crops and diseases that affect the animals.
She says that she has no time off from her duties.

loans.use: buy cement, rods and blocks to improve her home.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa continues working in the business of selling clothing in a local market. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. With this business Rosa wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her business selling clothing. She is requesting the loan to buy clothing wholesale, such as pants; jackets; and shirts for men, women, and children. Since her last loan, she says that her business has gone well, and she was able to grow her business substantially. She also says that she likes working with Asociación Arariwa because she is able to save money through her village bank.

Rosa is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo", located in the southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale, such as pants, jackets and shirts

loans.name: Mungunzul

texts.en:
Mungunzul, 32, is married and lives with her husband and daughter, aged 10, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the backyard of her husband’s workplace. Mungunzul's daughter goes to primary school.  

Mungunzul helps support her family by operating a retail stall at the Undram center. When she first began her business in 2010, she had 1,000,000 MNT in working capital, but she has since expanded it to 1,800,000 MNT. She sells bags, wallets, and remembrances. She purchases her products from Ereen, a border city in China. 

Janet is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy more bags, wallets, presents, and remembrances to sell to her customers.  She is a very trusted client of Transcapital Co. Ltd. Her main goal is to expand her business and then to be able to buy her own small house and yard.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya, where she has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years. Her farm currently produces milk, maize, tomatoes, and vegetables, which she sells at local markets. She says her farming income has helped her to bring up her family of eight children, two of whom are still in school.

Grace has requested a loan of 104,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure two dairy cows. She says she has been eager to improve the breeds of her dairy cows, and this loan will help her realize that dream. She also hopes to construct a zero grazing unit on her farm.

She says dairy animal diseases remain the most challenging aspect of farming.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en:
Zadock is 30 years old and has been actively farming for five successive years in his home area of Kitale, Westen Kenya. He is single and runs a farm that produces milk, maize, and beans, and sells to the local market. He also runs a pool table business.

Zadock has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will earn him more income and boost his other businesses so that he can support his siblings and develop a strong foundation for his family.

He says finding sources for farming capital is a challenge for many farmers, and he appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services they provide.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo has been actively farming for four years, producing mainly onions, milk, maize, and beans, which he sells to the local market. In addition to farming, he runs a motorcycle transport business. He is married with one child, who is three years old.

Paulo has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his farming income and enable him to improve his family's living standards. He remains optimistic that he will be able to buy more motorcycles and improve his transport business. This is his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo.

Paulo says diseases and occasional poor weather are some of the challenges he faces.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: La Mesa Centro Group

texts.es:
El grupo la “Mesa el Centro” está conformado por cuatro hombres y cuatro mujeres todos son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables ellos viven en una comunidad llamada La mesa centro es por eso que así le pusieron el mismo nombre a su grupo, éste grupo se caracteriza por tener un santuario de mariposa monarcas y donde al lugar llegan personas de varios lugares como turistas, Don Rodolfo quien es el representante del grupo tiene 51 años de edad está casado con la señora María Juana juntos tienen cuatro hijos que aun dependen de ellos pues asisten a la escuela, Don Rodolfo tiene una carpintería que tiene por nombre “El Membrillo” la carpintería tienen ya 25 años su carpintería la inicio debido a que en la ciudad de México trabajaba como carpintero aprendió muchas cosas y es por eso que decidió poner una en su casa, y así poder pasar mas tiempo son su familia, disminuir sus gastos aumenten y pudiera solventar los gastos de hogar, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar materia prima, como madera, pinceles, pintura, barniz, etc. El reto más grande que presenta don Rodolfo es que muchas veces no tiene la herramienta necesaria para realizar todos los pedidos que le encargan sus clientes muchas veces no ha podido cumplir con sus pedidos ya que los clientes no les gusta el diseño, se quejan porque es muy sencillo, porque no tiene el acabado que ellos quisieran es por eso que le dificulta cada vez mas tener éxito en su negocio. En su carpintería realiza todo tipo de muebles para el hogar como cunas, roperos, mesas, closets, mesas, muebles pequeños, etc. “A mi el crédito me ayudo de mucho ya que gracias a el he podido comprar mas material aunque mi meta o mi esperanza mas grande seria tener maquinaria más actualizada para complacer a mis clientes y quieran regresar para encargarme más muebles, para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de mis hijos y esposa”. Don Rodolfo y el resto del grupo están agradecidos con FRAC y Kiva ya que todos podrán invertir en su actividad.
Don Jesús, Pedro, Juvenal podrán invertir en su mantenimiento de su taxi, Doña Cecilia podrá invertir en la remodelación de su local, Lorena invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, Agustina compra borregos, Martha comprara becerros todos con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de cada una de su familia.
texts.en:
The group "La Mesa Centro" is made up of four men and four women, all of whom are hard-working and responsible people.  They live in a community called La Mesa center, which is the reason they chose the same name for their group.  This community is known for having a Monarch Butterfly sanctuary and is a place where people come from various places as tourists.

Don Rodolfo who is the representative of the group is 51-years-old, married to Señora María Juana, and together they have four children who still depend on them because they go to school.  Don Rodolfo has a carpentry shop that is named "El Membrillo" and has been around for 25 years.  He started his carpentry shop because in Mexico City he worked as a carpenter and learned many things.  That is why he decided to put one in his house and thus be able to spend more time with his family, reduce their cost increase, and be able to pay off their household expenses.

This time he has asked for the loan to buy raw materials like wood, paint brushes, paint, varnish, etc.  The biggest challenge that Don Rudolfo faces is that he often does not have the tools he needs to fulfill all the orders that his customers have placed with him.  Many times he has not been able to comply with the orders in such a way that his customers do not like the design and they complain that it is very simple because he has not finished it the way they wanted.  This is why it is increasingly difficult for him to succeed in his business.  In his carpentry shop he makes all kinds of furniture for the home, like cradles, wardrobes, tables, built-in cupboards, small furniture, etc.  

He says, "The loan has helped me a lot. Thanks to it I have been able to buy more material although my biggest goal or hope would be to have more up-to-date machinery to satisfy my customers so that they would want to return to order more furniture from me; to be able to improve the quality of life for my children and wife."

Don Rodolfo and the rest of the group are grateful to FRAC and Kiva since they all will be able to invest in their work.  Don Jesús, Pedro, and Juvenal will be able to invest in the maintenance of their taxi; Doña Cecilia will be able to invest in the remodeling of her restaurant; Lorena will invest in the purchase of groceries; Agustina will buy lambs; and Martha will buy calves - all in order to improve the quality of life of each of their families.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like wood, paintbrushes, and varnish.

location.town: La mesa,  san Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Asuncion Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Asunción de 40 años de edad, es madre soltera vive con sus tres hijos en la casa que renta ubicada en un barrio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, sus hijos van al colegio y su hija ya esta casada, Doña Asunción se dedica desde hace unos 15 años a la elaboración y venta de golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, carne  azada, pastelitos y pan, su venta es en su casa y también de forma ambulante en los barrios aledaños a su comunidad.
Doña Asunción solicita 8,000.00 lempiras para la compra de harina, leña, huevos, leche, mínimo verde que son la materia prima para preparar el pan y las golosina, con el préstamo Doña Asunción pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por con esto mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
El sueño de Doña Asunción es superarse en su negocio y que sus hijos vivan mejor y estudien, también su sueño es tener su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Asunción is a 40-year-old single mother. She lives with her three children in a rented house in a neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. Her children attend school and her daughter is already married. For about 15 years, Doña Asunción has been making and selling snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, roasted meats, turnovers, and bread. She sells from home and also as a street vendor in the surrounding neighborhoods of her community.

Doña Asunción is requesting 8,000 HNL in order to buy flour, firewood, eggs, milk, and green bananas since these are supplies that she needs for making bread and snacks. With this loan, she intends to improve her income so that she can provide a better quality of life for herself and her family. Doña Asunción dreams of succeeding in her business and seeing her children study and live better. She also hopes to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, eggs, milk, and green bananas.

loans.name: Mungunzul

texts.en:
Borrower Mungunzul is a 28-year-old married lady who has two sons and lives with her family in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of the Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

She and her husband have both supported their family by running a taxi business since 2010, while their parents look after for their two sons. From the daily income of their business, they bought their own small yard. 

Then they decided to build a new house on that yard, so they need money to purchase construction materials, which are very cheap in the beginning of the warm season. 

Mungunzul is requesting a loan of 3,900,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase some necessary construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase some construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy goats and poultry.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Mohamed from Lumley in Freetown. He is married with two children between the ages of two and 18 years, one of whom attends school. For the past ten years, Mohamed has been running a welding shop in a busy market area. He works at his business 26 days a month for ten hours a day and has four employees working for him. He does not have any other sources of income. He faces problem like debts owed to him by customers.

Mohamed has requested a loan to buy more welding machines. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living and educate his child. In the future, he plans to increase his savings and open a welding center to train youths. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more welding machines.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is 41 and has been in farming for ten years. She employs one farmhand and produces milk, maize, beans, fruits, and eggs, which she sells in the local market. In addition to farming, Rodah also runs a tailoring business. She is single and has two children aged 17 and 12 years.

Rodah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds at 30,000 KES and construct a modern dairy unit at 30,000 KES. She says the poultry farming business has good prospects due to a good market. She hopes to be a major supplier of eggs in the local market. She also hopes to meet her children's education needs using her farming income.

She says poultry diseases have been a major challenge and still remain a threat to the farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 33 years old and married with one child, age 9 months. He runs a spare parts store in Lumly western area in Freetown. His store is within a busy market.

He's been in this business for 5 years and sells farm belts, engine oil, tires, and assorted spare parts. His business is the only source of income he has. He describes his biggest business challenges as competition in market and the low purchasing power of his customers.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy a stock of items to sell in his spare parts store, such as farm belts, engine oil, and tires. He will use the dividend from this loan to pay his child's school fees. In the future, he would like to expand his business to become a supplier. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy stock of items to sell in his spare parts store, such as farm belts, engine oil, and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Mohamed from Godrich western area in Freetown. He is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 12 years. Two of his children attend school.

Mohamed runs a building material and provision store; he sells cement, paint, nails, powdered milk, sugar, and butter. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works at the business 12 hours and 6 days per week and has one employee working for him. His other source of income comes from transportation by commercial bike. Mohamed says that the main challenge to his business is insufficient to capital to invest in his business.

Mohamed has requested a loan to buy building materials such as cement, nails, shovels, and paint. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open more branches and employ additional staff. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy building material such as cement, nails, shovels, and paint.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a farmer in Nkubu area, where she lives with her family of four adult children, save for the last born, who is 15 and still schooling. Her farm produces mainly cereals and milk, which are sold to the local market. She also runs a cereals retail shop in the local market.

Mercy has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats at 20,000 KES and to construct a zero grazing unit. She hopes she will expand her dairy business and buy more dairy cows. She aspires to have ten dairy goats and three dairy cows, and to venture into fish farming as well.
 
She laments of poor market prices in the local market.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats and construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Joseph from Krootown, Sierra Leone. He is married with two children between the ages of nine and four years, one of whom is currently attending school. In 2004, Joseph established his clothing store business. He began his business because it is very popular with women customers. He works at his business six days a week, and he says that even though his customer base has grown, he still has insufficient capital to operate his business.

Joseph requires a loan of 6,000,000 SLL to buy more clothes, such as ladies' jeans, suitcases, shoes, bags, sandals, and ladies' shirts. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Joseph plans to operate an international business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Idrissa. His store is around a busy market in Goderich. He is married with two children between the ages of 3 and 8 years.

Idrissa runs a general merchandise store business; he sells variety of items such as bottled drinks, star beer, bundled water, eggs, and cosmetics. He has been running this business for 8 years. He works at the business 10 hours a day and 6 days per week. He also works as a radio mechanic to increase his income to support his family's needs. He describes his biggest challenge as competition in the market.

Idrissa has requested a loan in order to buy more stock of items to sell in his general store. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to establish more business centers in other locations. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: LA Asociación comunal rosa de saron la conforman diez emprendedoras las cuales se han unidos para  ser beneficiadas con el financiamiento de bancos comunales que fundación león 2000 brinda, hasta la fecha ellos han demostrado responsabilidad, solvencia de pago, y crecimiento en sus actividades económica,  a pesar que todos tiene diferentes actividades la Sra. Ceferina  esta emprendedora se desempeña en la actividad económica de venta de cosa de horno la elabora y vende en su casa de habitación  gracias a su buena clientela ha crecido su negocio es por esa razón que necesita más financiamiento para comprar  materiales para la elaboración de cosa de horno como:  maíz, aceite, leña, utensilio de cocina y de esa forma poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: The Rosa de Saron (Rose of Sharon) communal bank is made up of ten entrepreneurs who have come together to benefit from the communal bank financing that Fundación León 2000 offers. Up to this point, they have demonstrated responsibility, the ability to make repayments, and growth in their economic activities, despite the fact that they all do different things. Ceferina is an entrepreneur who sells "cosa de horno" (an assortment of baked goods). She makes and sells it in her house. Thanks to her good customer base, her business has grown. This is why she needs more financing in order to buy materials to make cosa de horno, such as corn, oil, firewood, and cooking utensils. In this way, she will be able to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, firewood and cooking utensils to satisfy the demand of her customers

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha lives in Airport Community. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 14, two of whom are in school and all three of them live at home. 

For 15 years she has been selling rice, palm oil, and other items in the market. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys her business because she makes a lot of profit.

Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya, where she lives with her seven children who are still schooling. She has 20 solid years in farming and produces milk, maize, beans, and vegetables. She also operates a retail shop in the local market for additional income.

Bernadette has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy poultry birds for a venture into a poultry farming business. She adds that the poultry business will help her boost her dairy business as well.

She says that animal diseases and feeds remain major business challenges because of the high costs of feeds and drugs.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 49 years old and lives in Airport Community with her husband and children. All of her children are in school and between 17 and 27 years old.

For two years now, Theresa has been selling fresh fish and rice in the market. In addition, her aunt taught her how to make local soap and sell it; by this means she was able to expand her local soap business to a fresh fish business. Since she started selling fresh fish two years ago, she makes more profit. Now she asks for a loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Fatu W.

texts.en:
Fatu is 34 years old and lives in Airport community. She has four children between 1 and 18 years old; three are in school and all of them live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past 7 years, Fatu has been selling rice in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 48 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is married with six children between 12 and 34 years old. One is in school and lives at home, while the oldest ones are living on their own and are out of high school or a college student. For the past 3 years she has been selling charcoal and used clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and clothes for her business. She was taught by her mother, and with the savings from this business in the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and clothes for her business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer with ten years of experience. He has been producing and selling fruits and vegetables to the local market. He is married with one child age 4 years.

James has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy water pipes, which he will use to set up an irrigation system in his farm. He hopes to be able to buy a car to ease the supply of his farm produce, both transporting from the farm during harvest as well as delivering them to the markets.

He says the high costs of farm inputs and lack of financial resources has been the major challenges farmers have to grapple with.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in Airport community and is 27 years old. She is married and has two children ages 4 and 9; they live at home and attend school. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past 18 years, Fatu has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in Airport community and is 30 years old. She is married and has four children between 4 to 13 years old; all of them live at home and are in  school. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past 10 years, Annie has been selling palm oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and lives in Airport community. She has six children between 4 months and 14 years old. 

For the past 10 years, Emma has been operating a cook shop (restaurant). She enjoys the flow of her customers. Emma is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, rice, onions, salt, Vita (a juice drink made by Coca Cola for the African market), and coal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, rice, onions, salt, Vita, and coal for her business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna  is 46 years old, lives in the Airport community, and has eleven children between the ages of 9 and 30. For the past fifteen years, she has been  operating a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian dishes. She enjoys the flow of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, onion, salt, vita and charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, onion, salt, vita and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo is 45 years old and lives in the Airport Community.  She has seven children between 14 and 30 years old, two of whom are in school and live at home, while the oldest ones are living on their own.  

For the past ten years, Korpo has been selling dried fish in the local market. She is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish for her business. Her future plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for her business

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda lives in the Airport Community.  She is 40 years old and married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 19.  Her children are in school and live at home.  Her husband works with Firestone. 

For the past 13 years now, Finda has been selling rice, pepper, vita, and others items in the local market. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice, pepper, vita, and others items for her business. Her plan for the future is to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, vita, and others items for her business

loans.name: Yumina

texts.en:
Yumina is a 46-year-old lady who is married to Yanri, a 48-year-old man. They are blessed with five children: Helga, 20; Joice, 19 who is in the third grade of Junior High School; Eben, 15, who is in the second grade of Junior High School; Yermia, 8, who is in the third grade of Elementary school; and Robert, 5.
 
Yumina generates income for her family by selling vegetables (i.e. mustard greens, tomatoes, string beans and chilies.) She purchases these vegetables around her village and resells them at the market. Sometimes she needs to go to the farthest village in order to get fresh vegetables to be sold. Yumina does this solely to meet the needs of her family.
 
Yumina plans to send her eldest daughter Helga to university this year. In addition, she realizes that to implement her dream she will need a bigger amount of money. Yumina is thinking about her business improvement by increasing the quantity of vegetables that she sells.  So she is taking part in TLM through the Individual Lending program and is requesting IDR 5,000,000 for business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as mustard greens, tomatoes, string bean etc to sell

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay lives in Buchanan with her seven children who are between the ages of 1 and 28 years old. She is 48 years old, married, and has been involved in business for the past ten years. Janjay started her business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plans for the future are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en:
Janjay lives in Buchanan.  She is 35 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 10 and 15 who are in school and live at home. Her husband works with a road contractor company. 

Janjay started her business with money given to her by her mother and learned it from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal  for her business. Her plans for the future are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Buchanan. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 13 and 22 who are in school and live at home. 

For the past twenty years, Elizabeth has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business with her mother's help. She is asking for a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plans for the future are to buy a piece of land and a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Flores Magon Group

texts.es: Carol tiene 20 años y es parte del grupo Flores Magon, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde vive la mayoría  de las integrantes el andador se llama así flores Magon, ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de cristal swarovski,  imitación de perlas, canutillo, cuentas, piedras naturales, alambre, hilo nylon, hilo de cobre, grapas, ganchos, remaches, ya que hace pulseras, collares, anillos etc. Dice que los hace y los vende en la universidad donde estudia, dice que tiene haciendo sus creaciones desde hace más de tres años y emprendió el negocio para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la universidad. Ella está estudiando para educadora y ya está en  el tercer año y dice que está muy contenta y orgullosa de poderle ayudar a su padres ya que son gastos grandes los de la universidad. Dice que todos los materiales los compra en el estado de Jalisco ya que ahí le dan precios más baratos y así ella le puede ganar un poco más. Dice que gracias a los créditos que le han hecho poco a poco a crecido su negocio ya que antes nada mas vendía pulseras y collares y ahora también vende diademas con pedrería, cinturones con pedrería, relojes y mas accesorios para dama. Uno de sus sueños dice que es terminar su carrera y poder obtener una plaza como maestra de un jardín de niños y otro es poner un local estable donde pueda vender su bisutería. Las otras 12 integrantes se llaman María del socorro, Reyna, Clementina, Stephanie, Teresa, Patricia, Roció, Vianey, Norma, Mercedes, Rosa Elena, Jazmín todas ellas invertirán sus crédito en sus actividades económicas como en la compra de zapatos por catalogo, ropa y lencería, dulces de diferentes sabores, artículos de abarrotes, materia prima de para hacer sus postres, material para la elaboración de prendas, compra de cosméticos y joyería para dama, surtir colchas y blancos, bolsas para dama, etc.
texts.en:
Carol is 20 years old and a member of the 'Flores Magon' group.  She is requesting a loan to buy Swarovski crystals, imitation pearls, beads, glass tube beads, natural stones, wire, nylon thread, copper thread, staples, hooks and clasps for making bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc.  She says that she makes these products and sells them at the university where she is studying.  She says that she has been making her creations for more than three years.  She started the business in order to support her parents in covering her university expenses.  She is studying to become a teacher and is in her third year of her degree.  She says that she is very happy and proud to be able to help her parents because her university expenses are high.  She says that she buys all her materials in the state of Jalisco because there she is able to buy them for a lower price and so can earn a little more.  She says that, thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to gradually grow her business.  In the past she only sold bracelets and necklaces but now she also sells tiaras with gems, belts with gems, watches and other ladies' accessories.  She says that one of her dreams is to finish her degree and get a position as a teacher in a kindergarten.  Another of her dreams is to have stable premises from which to sell her jewelry.

The other 12 members of this group are called María del Socorro, Reyna, Clementina, Stephanie, Teresa, Patricia, Rocio, Vianey, Norma, Mercedes, Rosa Elena and Jazmín.  They will all invest their loans in their business activities such as buying shoes through a catalog, clothing and lingerie, different flavored sweet treats, groceries, raw materials for making desserts, material for making clothes, cosmetics and ladies' jewelry, bedspreads, ladies' bags etc.

loans.use: to buy Swarovski crystals, imitation pearls, glass tube beads, beads, natural stones, wire, nylon thread, copper thread, staples, hooks and clasps for making bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc.

loans.name: Aml's Group

texts.en:
This group is called HAMOUDA. It consists of six ladies:  Aml, Thoria, Bhyah, Fthya, Muna and Wafa. They are trying to provide a better life so they took a loan of 150,000 YER. 

Aml is a 27-year-old, single woman who always has wanted to provide a good quality of life. She is the third woman from the right in the photo. This is why she has always been determined to work in order to earn money to get ahead and in this way, she can provide the best conditions in life that she is able to. She lives in Hodeida, Yemen and has been operating a beauty salon for three years. Her brother helped her to buy cosmetics and makeup materials when she was working in a room of her house. She did all of these to improve her living conditions. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy cosmetics, a hair dryer and makeup materials. She hopes to expand her business so that she can open a hairdresser's shop where she can earn extra income in order to be able to support all of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, a hair dryer and makeup materials for her business

loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Dalia Sonia habita en una comunidad del municipio de El Sauce, desde muy joven se ha caracterizado por ser responsable trabajadora ya que desde entonces labora como profesora de primaria generando sus propios ingresos y llevando el pan de cada día a la casa de sus padres, teniendo así gran experiencia en enseñar a leer y escribir a los niños de este municipio, profesión que tiene gran mérito por ser estas personas que aportan un granito de arena al desarrollo de nuestro país.
Hoy en la actualidad tiene a cargo su único hijo a quien le da la mejor  educación y condiciones de vida por tal razón está solicitando su cuarto crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y arena con el fin de construir una habitación para su hijo con el objetivo de que tenga más espacio y privacidad ya que cada día va creciendo y va para adulto.
Espera que ceprodel le apruebe su solicitud para cumplir el sueño de su hijo.
texts.en:
Dalia Sonia lives in a community in El Sauce municipality. From her youth, she has been considered  responsible and hard-working. Since then, Dalia Sonia has taught primary school, generating her own income and providing  the daily bread for her parents' house. As a result, she has much experience in teaching the children of the municipality to read and write. Her profession deserves great credit because it is people like her who provide a little grain of sand for the development of our country.

Today, Dalia Sonia has her only son in her charge, and she is providing him with the best education and conditions of life. For that reason, she is requesting her 4th loan, for the purpose of buying bricks, cement, and sand to finish constructing a home for her son, so that he can have more space and privacy as, every day, he grows into adulthood.

Dalia Sonia hopes that Ceprodel will approve her request so that she can accomplish her son's dream.

loans.use: buy bricks, cement, and sand to complete construction of her son's house.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
El señor Clemente de 55 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Nacaome valle. Junto con el vive esposa y sus hijos quienes trabajan juntos para poder salir a delante. Su dedicación siempre ha sido  al comercio y también   a la ganadería.
El  negocio de Don Clemente  es una pulpería en la cual vende todo tipo de abarrotaría como ser, aceite, jabon, lácteos, embutidos, asistin, maseca arroz, frijoles, refrescos el esta solicitando su préstamo un préstamo de 10,000.00 lempiras para invertirlos en la compra de embutidos, condimentos, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, lácteos, detergente y otros producto para su negocio.
Con las utilidades que Don Clemente  genere el negocio será mucho mas productivo.
El sueño de Don Clemente  es que su negocio sea más surtido y poder mejorar su casa y ayudar a tener una mejor vida a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Señor Clemente, age 55, lives in a small hamlet in Nacaome Valle with his wife and children. They work together to get ahead. Clemente has always worked in business and livestock.
Clemente has a general store where he sells all sorts of grocery items such as oil, soap, dairy products, sausages, Asistin-brand cleaner, Maseca-brand corn masa flour, rice, beans, and pop. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras in order to invest in the purchase of sausages, condiments, beans, rice, sugar, butter, soap, dairy products, detergent, and other products for his business.
With the income from this investment, Clemente's business will be much more productive.
His dream is for his business to be better-stocked, to be able to improve his home, and to help his family to have a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to buy sausages, condiments, beans, rice, sugar, butter, soap, dairy products, detergent, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, vive en una aldea de Tela, Atlántida con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de entre  1 a 17 años de edad.
hace 4 años que dejo el trabajo de jornalero para tener una fuente de ingresos fijos para manutención de su familia, desde entonces que estableció una pulpería para la venta de productos alimenticios de la canasta básica familiar como ser, granos básicos, manteca, huevos, productos de limpieza, embutidos refrescos, lácteos, carnes etc. 
Don Juan Pablo ha solicitado 4 préstamos anteriores para surtir su negocio, donde ha podido aumentar los ingresos necesarios. Actualmente solicita el quinto préstamo por 10,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de productos como granos básicos, lácteos y refrescos.
Todo su esfuerzo es para lograr obtener ingresos que le permitan darle buena educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 46 years old and married.  He lives in the village of Tela, Atlántida with his wife and four children between the ages of 1 and 17.

Four years ago he left his job as a day worker in order to have a source of fixed income to support his family.  He then established a store to sell staple products like basic grains, lard, eggs, cleaning products, sausages, soft drinks, dairy products, and meat, etc.

Juan Pablo has requested four previous loans to stock his business, and he has been able to increase the income that he needs.  He is currently requesting his fifth loan for 10,000 lempiras to stock products like basic grains, dairy products, and soft drinks.

All of his efforts are to manage to get income that will allow him to give his children a good education and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his business with food staples like corn, beans, rice, dairy products, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Miad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Miad. It consists of four members: Shmah, Amnh, Zbibh and Fatima who lives in Hodeida, Yemen. They took out a loan of 110,000 YER. 

Shmah is 55 years old. She is the woman with the handbag in front of her. She is married and has seven children. She has been selling clothes, incense and perfumes for 15 years. She is experienced in her business. She started her business with a small amount of capital. She received money from the ladies association, which enabled her to expand her business to sell clothes, incense and perfumes. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from to buy extra clothes, incense and perfumes for her business. She hopes to expand her business and get more profit.

loans.use: to buy extra clothes, incense and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Ramòn

texts.es:
Ramón  es un hombre de 56 años de edad, estado civil soltero y sin hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  y está ubicada en el Caserío  CP – 2 Cólera, distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 150 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Jorge es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino, caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente  se dedica a la agricultura donde cuenta con 2.0 ha de terreno agrícola que tienen instalado limón, en producción viene cosechando semanalmente lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
