Cris está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá construir una ramada que es una especie de techo hecho por materiales naturales, ya que en esta ciudad hace mucho calor y con ello mejoraría la atención a sus clientes. Así ella seguirá trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Cris, 29, is a young woman and mother of a one year and two month old little boy who is her greatest blessing and the reason for her to continue forward despite obstacles that might arise.  Her husband is always by her side; he works as a taxi driver and always supports her.

Her house is located in the city of Pucallpa, a city with marvelous flora and fauna and a city where one can disconnect from problems awed by the beautiful scenery found there.  Like all good Peruvians, she enjoys our country’s cuisine very much and her favorite dish is the very delicious Ceviche [marinated seafood].  When she has a little free time she likes to take advantage of it to thoroughly clean her house.  She only studied secondary school but would have liked to have studied Graphic Design.

Cris rises daily with much enthusiasm to work in her business selling food, juice and soft-drinks.  She spends about 12 hours daily at work and also helps her husband work as a taxi driver.  In a day she can tend to up to 20 customers and she believes she does well in her business because she’s kind to all her customers and because she’s very enthusiastic and that enthusiasm causes her customers to happily return to her business.

Cris is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to build a ‘ramada’ which is a type of overhang made from natural materials because it’s very hot in her community and this would improve her customer service so that she can continue working and striving toward making her greatest dream a reality:  to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to build a thatch overhang.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Unido De Suretka Group

texts.es:
Nancy es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Unido de Suretka, es un grupo con mucha trayectoria en Fundación Mujer,  y buena conducta de pago. 
Esta señora tiene 32 años, es casada, y no tiene hijos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, desarrolla diversas actividades, como el comercio, y tiene una pequeña pulpería, también vende comidas rápidas los fines de semana y días feriados y por si fuera poco elabora manualidades y vende en su comunidad, todo esto para contribuir  con los gastos familiares y además ayudarle a una hermana que estudia en la universidad. 
Este es el quinto crédito que solicita y los anteriores han sido de gran ayuda para consolidar y hacer crecer sus negocios. Y su meta es llegar a tener un pequeño supermercado que tenga  todo tipo de mercadería. 
Junto a Nancy hay 7 socias más,  que desarrollan actividades comerciales y agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Nancy is the president of the communal bank "Mujer Unido de Suretka."  This group has a long history with Fundacion Mujer, and has a good credit record.  Nancy is 32 years old, married, and has no children.  She is a very enterprising woman who has developed a number of different businesses, such as retail trade.  She has a small grocery store and she also sells fast food on the weekends and holidays, and last, but not least, she makes handicrafts which she sells in her community.  She does all of this to contribute to the household finances and also to help her brother who studies at the university.  She is requesting her 5th loan.  The previous loans really helped her to strengthen and grow her businesses.  Her goal is to eventually have a small supermarket where she could sell all types of merchandise.  

Next to Nancy, there are 7 other members of the group who are all developing retail or agricultural businesses.

loans.use:
to buy merchandise such as groceries, cleaning products, and other 
products for her store

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married mother of two children who are both in school. Her husband is a hotelier and Sidi has her own business selling clothes that she has been running for the last 2 years. The family lives in a rented room without access to water or electricity and their greatest monthly expenditures are food and water. 

Sidi wants to use the loan to add inventory and expand her existing business. She sells the clothes in a shop to female customers. The greatest challenges affecting her business are seasonality and the selling of items on credit. Sidi chose to work with Yehu because of lower interest rates than competing microfinance institutions. Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and increase her inventory

loans.name: Dony Donadony

texts.es:
Dony es un joven de 21 años el cual es muy entusiasta y sobre todo muy hábil, vive al lado de su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad, para Dony es el mejor regalo que Dios le ha podido dar y la bendición más grande que una familia puede tener; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por playas hermosas, clima cálido y sobre todo porque es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano así como también por su riquísima sazón para la elaboración de platillos. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Dony trabaja en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi en el cual trabaja 10 horas al día pero también tiene su negocio de venta de ropa en el cual es apoyado por su esposa quien se encarga de la atención del pequeño puesto de venta de ropa que tiene, en el día puede atender hasta 25 clientes y es que el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable y respetuoso con los clientes tanto en su negocio como chofer como en la venta de ropa y sobre todo porque da gracias a Dios tanto en las buenas como en las malas porque le ha permitido salir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos.

Dony está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de ropa en especial ropa de invierno para niños y adultos y también comprar muebles y un juego de comedor para su casa, con lo cual mejorar sus ingresos y también brindara comodidad a su familia y asi el seguirá luchando cada día por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una mototaxi propia y mejorar su negocio de venta de ropa”.
texts.en:
Dony, 21, is a young, very enthusiastic but above all very skilled man.  He lives with his wife and three year old little boy who for Dony is the best gift God could have given him and the greatest blessing a family can have.  

His house is located in the city of Chincha, a city noted for its beautiful beaches, hot weather and above all because it’s the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes and because of the tasty way its cuisine is prepared.

With much effort and dedication, Dony works driving a mototaxi for about 10 hours daily but also has a business selling clothes that his wife helps him with; she tends to the small clothes selling stand they have.  In a day he can take care of up to 25 customers and he believes he does well because of the kind and respectful way he treats his customers both in the business and as a taxi driver and above all because he thanks God both in good times and in bad because He’s made it possible for him to get ahead despite obstacles.

Dony is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be buy more merchandise for his clothing business especially winter clothes for children and adults and will also buy furniture and a dining room set for his house that he’ll improve his income with and provide better comfort for his family to continue striving daily to make his greatest dream a reality: to own a mototaxi and to improve his clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes and a dining room set.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is an industrious and responsible wife and mother to her four children. She is 57 years of age and a married woman. She and her husband have operated their fish pond and hog raising businesses for ten years. 

Teresita aims to improve the growth of her fingerlings due to the many orders. To accomplish her plans, she is requesting additional working capital in the amount of P10,000. She will use this loan to purchase aqua feeds and livestock feeds for raising hogs and fingerlings. She hopes that she could increase the number of her fingerlings in order to get greater income and to satisfy her customer demand.

Teresita would be thankful if the loan she requested is granted. She is also hoping for growth improvement of the hogs she is raising. This way, she could lift her living condition out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy aqua feeds and livestock feeds for raising hogs and fingerlings

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una joven de 33 años, la cual es muy luchadora y sobre todo optimista y para ella no existe un no puedo, vive al lado de su esposo el cual es su mano derecha en todo y al lado de su mejor y más importante regalo que Dios y la vida le han podido dar, su hija de 2 años la cual con su sonrisa hace que Silvia se olvide de los problemas y siga adelante; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual son las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas, así como también playas hermosas; gracias a estos bellísimos lugares Silvia trabajo en una agencia de turismo y allí aprendió mucho y por ello tuvo la iniciativa de tener una agencia de turismo, con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro salir adelante y su negocio ya lleva 4 años; ella cree que le va bien porque es muy amable y honrada con los turistas y sobre todo porque tiene un carisma singular cuando atiende a los clientes.

Silvia está muy agradecida con la ayuda y la oportunidad que los prestatarios Kiva le han brindado ya que gracias a ello Silvia podrá realizar la remodelación y ambientación de su agencia de turismo y podrá comprar los accesorios para su oficina y con ello dar una mejor atención a los clientes y con ello mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando día a día para ver hecho realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a  su hija y crecer en su agencia de Turismo”.
texts.en:
Silvia, 33, is a very tenacious but above all optimistic young woman; for her "I can’t" does not exist.  She lives with her husband who is her right hand in everything she does and with her two year old daughter who’s the most important gift God and life could possibly give her; just with her smile she makes Silvia forget her problems and carry on.

Her house is located in the city of Pisco, a city noted for having one of the country’s most important tourist attractions: the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum as well as beautiful beaches.  Thanks to these very beautiful places Silvia worked for a travel agency and learned much there so then she decided to have a travel agency herself and with much effort and saving managed to do so; her business has been in operation four years now.  She believes she does well in it because she’s very kind and honest with tourists and above all because she has a singular charisma when she takes care of them.

Silvia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her Silvia will be able to remodel and upgrade her tourist agency and will be able to buy accessories for her office to provide better customer service thus improving her income to continue striving day to day to make her greatest dream a reality:  to give her daughter a good education and to make her tourist agency grow.

loans.use: to remodel her tourist agency.

loans.name: Hadie

texts.en:
Hadie is a married mother of four children and has a business selling water. Three of her children are in school and one is still too young to attend. Her husband works as a mason. She runs her business from her family home, which they own and which has access to both electricity and water. Their greatest monthly expenses are school fees. 

Hadie would like to use the loan to open a cafe business, as she has five years experience within the industry. Her customers would be neighbors and people from Mkokoleni. Hadie anticipates the challenge of running this business and will be careful with money management as she will be selling on credit. Hadie's dream for a long time has been to open her own cafe. 

Hadie wants to work hard to increase their sources of income to ensure that all of her four children successfully manage to complete their schooling from start to finish.

loans.use: to open a new cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy diving equipment and an air compressor.

loans.name: Domingo José

texts.es:
El señor Domingo José, es casado,  trabaja  para el ministerio de salud como técnico en vectores de ciudad de León, inicia sus labores de 7:00 am a 3:00 pm de lunes a viernes.

Domingo solicitó a ceprodel un segundo crédito para compra  zinc, piedrín y golosos, los que serán utilizados para cambio de techo de su vivienda ya que está en mal estado, en vista que se aproxima la temporada lluviosa.

Domingo se siente agradecido con Ceprodel  por el apoyo que  le ha brindado para mejorar su vivienda y la calidad de vida de él y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo José is married and is employed by the Ministry of Health as a Vectors Technician in the city of León; he works from 7am until 3pm, Monday through Friday.

Domingo asked Ceprodel for a second loan to buy metal sheeting, gravel and screws he’ll use to replace the roof on his house because it’s in bad shape and the rainy season is approaching.

Domingo is grateful to Ceprodel for the support provided to improve his house and his and his entire family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, gravel and screws.

loans.name: Carlos German

texts.es:
El joven Carlos German, es soltero con deseo de superación,  trabaja  como operario en una zona franca  de  la ciudad de León, sus labores la realiza en turno variado.

Carlos  solicitó a ceprodel su primer crédito para compra  cemento, bloque,  arena, hierro y piedrín, para construcción de un cuarto.

El Joven se siente agradecido  con Ceprodel  por la oportunidad que  le ha brindado de obtener su cuarto donde tendrá una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos German is a single young man with a desire to overcome. He works as an operator in a tax-free zone in the city of León. He works different shifts.

Carlos asked for his first loan from Ceprodel in order to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron, and gravel to build a room.

He is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity it has given him to obtain his room, where he will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, blocks, sand, iron, and gravel

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: El Sr. Froilán tiene 45 años y es casado con 2 hijos de las edades de 10 y 19 años, su actividad es la de venta de alimentos en un snack cafetería que se encuentran en una de las avenidas más populosas de la ciudad de El alto, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Froilán va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una computadora para los estudios de sus hijos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es pensando en la educación de sus hijos, el Sr. Froilán enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria ya que por la zona existen varias cafeterías y va a utilizar los beneficios en el apoyo educativo de sus hijos. Su deseo para su negocio es verse como un empresario, administrando una cadena de cafeterías en la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Froilán, 45, is married and has two children who are 10 and 19 years old.  His activity is selling food in a snack bar located in one of the city of El Alto’s most crowded avenues.

This loan is his third sequence within the institution.  Froilán will use the loan to buy a computer for his children’s school work.  His reason for requesting the loan is thinking about his children’s education.

The business challenge Froilán faces is daily competition because there are several cafeterias in his zone.  He will use profits to support his children’s education.  His wish for his business is to see himself as a businessman running a chain of cafeterias in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: to buy a computer fo his children's school work.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 51 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 16 y 18 años,  ella se dedica  al venta de ropa, su puesto  se encuentran en la ciudad de Oruro, compra ropa en la ciudad de la Paz y va  a vender ropa a la ciudad de Oruro ella, viaja dos veces a la semana los días miércoles y sábados que son los días de feria en la ciudad de Oruro, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Carmen va a utilizar este préstamo de para compra de diferentes modelos de ropa para surtir su negocio con variedad de prendas de vestir,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de inventario. La Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios llegando de apoco a tener una tienda propia en la ciudad de La Paz y así no tener que viajar ya que es un poco agotador para ella pero tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. En la foto la Sra. Carmen se encuentra en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 51, is married and has two children who are 16 and 18 year sold.  She sells clothes.  Her stand is located in the city of Oruro.  She buys clothes in the city of La Paz and goes to sell it in the city of Oruro.  She travels twice a week on Wednesdays and Saturdays which are the market days in the city of Oruro.  

This is her first loan sequence within the institution.  Carmen will use this loan to buy various styles of clothes to stock her business with a variety of articles of clothing.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase her inventory.  

The business challenge Carmen faces is competition.  She will use profits to gradually obtain a store of her own in the city of La Paz so as not to have to travel any longer which is a bit exhausting for her but she has to do it for her family’s wellbeing.  

In the photo Carmen appears in the company of her husband.

loans.use: to buy various styles of clothing.

loans.name: Wilfredo Edilberto

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero. Él se ha sido empleado en una farmacia en el área de ventas, hoy en día esta trabajando en una gasolinera y fue en este trabajo que se de cuenta del potencial que tenia el negocio de comida, ubicado en una pequeña casa cerca de la gasolinera. Él se aventuro e instalo el negocio y obtuvo muy buenos resultados, ya que al mismo tiempo que trabaja en la gasolinera tiene su propio negocio y a contratado a una persona para que lo atienda. Su horario de trabajo es de 9:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m.

Los productos se los llegan a dejar al negocio los distribuidores. El préstamo que esta solicitando Wilfredo es para comprar vitrinas, estantes, mesas, mostrador de comida, panes para hacer hot dog y hamburguesas. De esta forma ampliara su negocio, será más prospero y tendrá más oportunidad de vender, percibiendo más y mejores ingresos por que que muchos clientes ya no llegan a comprar por falta de productos.

Wilfredo se ve en un futuro con otro local más cercano a la gasolinera o bien cerca de donde vive él.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 30 years old and single.  He’s been an employee in a pharmacy in the sales area and today is working at a gas station.  It was in this job that he noted the potential a food business located in a small house near the gas station had.  He took the leap and installed the business and got very good results because while being employed in the gas station he also has a business of his own and he hired a person to tend to it.  His work schedule is 9am to 9pm.

His products are delivered by suppliers directly to the business.  The loan Wilfredo is asking for is to buy display cases, shelving, tables, a food counter and bread for hot-dogs and hamburgers.  In this way he will expand the business, it will be more profitable and he’ll have more sales opportunities thus earning more and improved income because many customers don’t get to buy because of lack of products.  Wilfredo sees in his future another locale even closer to the gas station or near where he lives.

loans.use: to buy display cases, shelving, tables, counter and bread to make hot-dogs and hamburgers.

loans.name: Mirador De Yahuarcocha Group

texts.es:
El mirador de Yahuarcocha es un grupo de 5 mujeres emprendedoras, que tienen un mismo fin, que es el de salir adelante con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. En este grupo la presidenta es Paola, en la fotografía es la segunda persona empezando desde la izquierda, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy responsable. Vive en la ciudad de Ibarra con sus padres.

Paola trabaja junto con sus compañeras en un taller de confección de blusas de tela indú. Es el primer crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de una máquina de cocer industrial, que ayudará a optimizar tiempo y ayudará a una mejor productividad.

Paola sueña en tener un taller grande para poder emplear a personas que necesiten.
texts.en:
El Mirador de Yahuarcocha is a group of 5 entrepreneurial women who have the same goal, which is to move forward with their business in order to improve their quality of life. In this group the president is Paola. In the photograph she is the second person starting from the left. She is known for being an entrepreneurial woman, hard-working, and very responsible. She lives in the city of Ibarra with her parents.

Paola works together with her coworkers in a workshop making shirts of Indian fabric. This is her first loan with Fodemi, and it will be used to purchase an industrial sewing machine that will help to save time and increase productivity.

Paola dreams of having a large workshop in order to be able to employ people who need it.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felicia; Ella continúa realizando sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquiler de habitaciones de su casa, y también trabaja en venta de productos de belleza y ropa interior para damas.
Felicia por medio de estos negocios independientes saca adelante a sus hijos, y por ello  quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de alquiler de cuartos, conjuntamente con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y ropa interior. 
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como pintura y otros accesorios, para dar los acabados a  las habitaciones y posteriormente alquilarlas; y por supuesto para capitalizar su actividad adicional de comprar productos de belleza y ropa interior femenina al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANKACHA”; El banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco - Perú
texts.en:
Felicia continues carrying out her daily activities with her business renting rooms in her house and also works selling beauty products and women’s underwear.

Through these independent businesses Felicia is able to support her children and because of this wants to expand and improve the room rental business as well as the business selling beauty products and underwear.

She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies like paint and other accessories to give the rooms their finishing touches to subsequently rent them out and also to capitalize her additional activity buying beauty products and women’s underwear at wholesale.

She’s happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.  She belongs to the “Qorimankacha” communal bank located in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: Mercedita es una emprendedora que ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en crédito en el cual en el crédito anterior la emprendedora lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de productos, nos expresa que gracias al apoyo brindado ha aumentado su producto y de igual manera sus clientes. La emprendedora esta nuevamente solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes como pantalones, camisas, sandalias, blúmer entre otras productos.
texts.en: Mercedita is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000 financing.  She used her previous loan to invest in her business purchasing products.  She tells us that thanks to the support provided she’s increased her products as well as the number of her customers.  She is once again asking for financing to buy products to offer her customers like pants, shirts, sandals and underwear, among other products.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Kasindi Bus Women Group

texts.en: Jackline is a 33 year old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in the cutlery business for fifteen years. She started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings in working capital. Her main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, and her personal goal is educating her children. Her business goal is to expand business into new markets. Jackline wants money to buy home utensils to sell.

loans.use: to buy utensils to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Alfredo

texts.es:
Nelson es una persona trabajadora, responsable y muy preocupado por su familia. Nelson vive con su familia en Pimampiro que se encuentra a una hora de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Nelson tiene sembríos de tomate en invernadero, necesita seguir sembrando para tener una buena producción de tomates y que su negocio siga creciendo, lo cual realiza un nuevo crédito en Fodemi que lo va a invertir en la compra de  semillas de tomate, abono, y fungicidas para seguir en el sembrío y obtener una buena producción e incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Nelson sueña en construir otro invernadero para que sus tomates sean de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Nelson is a hardworking, responsible person who is very concerned for his family.  He lives with his family in Pimampiro which is located an hour away from Ibarra in Imbabura Province.

Nelson has tomatoes growing in a greenhouse and needs to continue planting in order to have a good tomato production and for his business to continue growing so he’s taking out a new Fodemi loan to buy tomato seeds, manure and fungicide to continue planting and to obtain a good production and increase his income to improve his family’s quality of life.

Nelson dreams with building another greenhouse so that his tomatoes will be of good quality.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a mother of five children aged between seven and fourteen; all of the children are enrolled in school. She has been selling clothes for 16 years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 26-year-old young woman; she is married to Mohammad and a mother with three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs and needs.

Samar is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new living room furniture. Getting this loan will allow Samar to improve her family's living conditions at home by having comfortable living room furniture. Samar appears in the picture holding her baby .

loans.use: to purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, a 40-year-old single woman with four children, has been operating a salon business for two years now, earning a monthly income of 70,000 shillings. With her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy more beauty products. In the future Jane wants to boost her business and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata, a 49-year-old widow with five children between the ages of 18 and 25, all in school, has been working as a tailor for the past three years. With this loan she wants to buy threads and a sewing machine to use in her business. Consalata will pay her children's school fees with the resulting extra profits.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and threads for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel  es una mujer de 19 años de edad, estado civil soltero. Vive  en casa de sus padres. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Ex Aterrizaje La Peña  distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una ciudad de aproximadamente 80 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Maribel es  la venta de productos de belleza, también se dedica ala crianza de animales menores como aves de corral y caprinos  y los cría en parte exterior de su domicilio con apoyo de su madre. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 01 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce este tipo de negocio. 
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza  y compra de alimentos para engorde de sus animales ;y  poder atender a sus clientes en esta zona, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maribel is a single, 19-year-old woman. She lives in her parents house, located in the Ex Atterrizaje La Pena settlement, in Tambogrande district. The town of approximately 80 families has electrical service.

Maribel's main activity is selling beauty products. Also, she raises farm animals, such as chickens and goats, around her house with her mother's help. Maribel has been doing this for approximately one year. She learned the skill from her parents. Now she knows this type of business.

The amount of the loan Maribel is requesting is 1,500 new sols, which will be invested in purchasing beauty products and feed for fattening her animals. Then, she will be able to attend to her local customers, permitting her level of life to improve.

loans.use: buy beauty products to sell and feed for fattening her livestock.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kasagati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past five years, Justine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like soap and salt for resale, and it will help Justine generate greater profits and expand her business. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big wholesale shop. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like soap and salt for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plates, saucepans, and glasses to sell.

loans.name: Jean Leonard

texts.en: Jean Leonard is 30 years old. He sells clothes. He has been in this business for seven years. With the loan, he wants to buy more sweaters and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for his family. He would love to see his business prosper to the extent of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more sweaters and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 3 hijos ya adultos; Gladis es educadora y trabaja enseñando en un jardín de niños.

Gladis Solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que está haciendo mejoras su casa y necesita darle los acabados para terminar de construir.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; de la ciudad del  de Cusco.
texts.en:
Gladis, 66, is the member.  She’s married and has three adult children.  She’s a teacher and works teaching in a kindergarten.

Gladis is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies because she’s doing some home improvements and needs the finishing touches to complete construction.

She thanks those who by this means form part of this dream and commits to make her installment payments according to the schedule.  She belongs to the “Qorimankacha” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to finish building her house.

loans.name: Josè Manuel

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 39 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 01 hijo a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y su hijo. La casa está ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti de la provincia de Chiclayo y cuenta con servicio básicos agua, desagüe de luz, el lugar es  de aproximadamente 600 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla José  es  la venta de productos de primera necesidad como: aceite, arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc. y los comercializa en una parte de su domicilio donde atiende todos los días de la semana, así mismo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con su mototaxi. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente su cónyuge le apoya en el negocio.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 4000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su bodega y además va comprar dos play station que son juegos y poder atender a sus clientes en esta zona, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José, 39, has a spouse and one son in his care.  He lives in his own house which is located in Cayalti District in Chiclayo Province with his spouse and son; it has the basic utilities of water, sewage and electricity.  The place has approximately 600 families.

The activity José does is selling basic staple items like rice, oil, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.  He sells them in part of his house where he takes care of customers every day of the week.  He also works transporting passengers in his mototaxi.  He’s been in this activity for approximately six years having learned it from his parents which means he knows the line of work to perfection.  Hi spouse helps him with the business.

The amount of the requested loan is 4000 new soles that will be used to buy basic staple items for his store and also to buy two PlayStations which are games to be able to tend to his customers in this zone which will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store and also to buy two PlayStations.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is 49 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 8 children who are all currently in school. For the past 17 years, Bright has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Bright has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more motor spare parts for resale, and will help Bright to generate greater profits and educate his children. Bright hopes that in the future he will be able to renovate his house. 

Bright is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bright who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more motor spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a fifty-six-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for thirty-five years and she says that teaching is her passion and she enjoys sharing moments with her students. Her personal goals are educating children and building a permanent home. Jane wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Norma Gregoria

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de un  poblado de Larreynaga departamento de león, se desempeña como maestra de primaria con 3 años de laborar impartiendo clases en un colegio de la  Misma localidad, en caso de su núcleo familiar no tiene hijos es soltera, esta señora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de cerdos en pie, maíz, leña, condimentos, papas, hojas y amarradores Para Fortalecer en negocio con su mama ya que ella en conjunto ejercer esta actividad comercial y es la manera de apoyar  a su mama como lo ha venido haciendo la señora para darle la vida que hoy tienen, actualmente está solicitando el segundo financiamiento atravez del convenio firmado con dicho colegio, dicho financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, por eso es que se ha mantenido fiel a ceprodel como cliente activo siendo beneficiada con los créditos los que le han sido de gran impacto en su desarrollo y condiciones familiares, de los cuales se siente satisfecha con la relación crediticia.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from a village in Larreynaga, department of León. She works as a primary school teacher, and has spent 3 years giving classes in a primary school in the same region.  In terms of her immediate family, she doesn't have children and is single.  This woman is requesting financing to buy pigs, corn, firewood, seasonings, potatoes, leaves and ties to strengthen in business with her mother, now that they jointly run this commercial business. It is a way to support her mother, as she has made her and given her the life that she has today. 

Currently she is requesting a second loan through the signed agreement with said school. Said financing with help her improve her conditions and standard of living. Due to this she has stayed faithful to CEPRODEL as an active client, being benefitted by the loans which have had a great impact on her development and family conditions, with which she feels satisfied due to the credit relationship.

loans.use: to buy pigs, corn, firewood, seasonings, potatoes, leaves and ties to strengthen the family business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a married man with 2 children, both of whom attend school. He rents a house located at Likoni on the south coast of Kenya. The house has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past 10 years, Victor has been operating a ‘matatu’ business (a 14-seater public service vehicle) with the general public being his major customers. His major business challenge is thieves. He dreams of buying a bus which has a higher carrying capacity compared to a ‘matatu’.

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to repair the vehicle which has developed mechanical problems. Victor decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To repair a motor vehicle facing a mechanical problem.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es: Ketti es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Mi Banquito” la cual está conformado por 10 personas unidas y responsables, siendo la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona de Matucana. Ketti de 38 años de edad, es separada con 01 hija aún dependiente. Lleva más de 10 años dedicándose a la confección de  tejidos como chompas, ropones gorros, etc. la cual trabaja sobre pedidos. Aparte brinda servicios de limpieza, de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. Gracias a su trabajo Ketti ha podido brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.  Ella está feliz pues aparte de obtener ganancias con sus tejidos  es lo que le gusta hacer. Su plan a futuro es de poner una tienda donde pueda exhibir sus prendas elaborados por ella. El último crédito que solicito lo invertirá para la compra de lanas, ya que tiene pedidos por entregar. Ketti  al igual que todos los socios de la Alcancía Comunal “Mi Banquito” agradecen el crédito brindado. Ketti  es la primera del lado derecho, viste chompa morada y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Ketti is a member of the communal bank "Mi Banquito", which is formed by 10 united and responsible people. The majority are neighbors in the region of Matacana.  Ketti is 38 years old, is separated and has one dependent daughter.  She has spent more than 10 years working in tailoring sweaters, robes, caps, etc. which she makes based on orders. Aside, she offers cleaning services, from which she obtains further income for her home.  

Thanks to her work, Ketti has been able to offer a better quality of life to her daughter.  She is happy, because aside from obtaining profits with her tailoring, it is what she likes to do.  Her future plan is to set up a store where she can showcase her home-made garments.  The last loan she requested will be invested to buy wool, since she has orders to deliver.  Ketti, like every member of the communal bank "Mi Banquito" is thankful for the supplied loan. Ketti is the first on the right, with the purple sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with four children all attending school. She plans to use this loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to pay school fees for her son. 

Veronica sells fish at the market. She has been in this business for the last 18 years and dreams of opening a shop in the future. She describes theft as being her major drawback. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en: Pierre is 28 years old. He sells rice and has spent more than one year in that business. He has requested a loan to buy more rice for resale. He is very thankful for the business because of his determination of reinvesting the profits in the same business of selling rice.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale.

loans.name: Mbega

texts.en: Mbega is taking out another loan of Ksh 40,000 to open a new business of selling shoes. He plans to purchase more shoes for resale. He aspires of opening a shoe shop since he currently sells his shoes from home. Since the previous loan, his living standards and that of the family have greatly improved. Mbega is so grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the previous loan given to him.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children. For the past 2 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small boutique which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and be self-reliant. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Vasfiye

texts.en:
Vasfiye is a divorcee with 3 kids, the eldest of whom is 21 and the youngest is 17.  She started her career as a waxer and later took a course in hair dressing.  She continued her education in hair dressing for three years, eventually earning her certificate.  When she was sure that she had learned the job completely, she purchased the necessary equipment and opened up her hair salon.  

She has been Maya client for 4 years and has been purchasing equipment with the loans she has received from Maya.  With this first loan through Kiva, she intends to change the seats in her salon that seem to have worn out.  With what is left from her loan she is going to buy some hair coloring and other hair products to prepare for the summer season.  After renewing her shop and making it more appealing to her customers she will be set.  

She has hopes and plans for the future and remarks that she will feel safer once she has retired with a retirement fund, yet she will continue to work.  She wants her children to be able to finish their studies and get jobs for themselves.  Vasfiye is a determined lady who strives for and holds on to the idea of a better life.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and volunteers

Vasfiye,3 çocuğu olan boşanmış bir kadın.  En küçüğü 17,en büyüğü 21 yaşında.  Vasfiye iş hayatına ağdacılık yaparak başladı.  Sonra kuaförlük kursuna başladı.  Çıraklık eğitimine katılarak 3 yıl devam etti ve sertifikalarını aldı.  İşini iyi öğrendiğinden emin olunca kuaför malzemelerini alarak,kuaför salonu açtı.  Maya ile 4 yıldır çalışıyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredilerle malzemeler aldı.  Maya’dan aldığı son kredi ile ,dükkanındaki  koltuklar çok yıpranmış,onları değiştirecek.  Kalan kısmı ile boya ve bakım malzemeleri alacak.  Yaz sezonuna hazırlık yapacak.  Dükkanı yeniledikten sonra,müşterinin göz zevkine hitap etmiş olacak,boya ve bakım malzemeleri elinde hazır olacak.  Gelecekle ilgili planları ve ümitleri var.  Emekli olunca kendini daha güvende hissedeceğini söylüyor,işine de devam edecek.  Çocuklarının okullarını bitirmesini ve iş güç sahibi olmalarını istiyor.  Vasfiye,tek başına mücadele edip,sıkı sıkı hayata tutunan bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy some hair coloring and other hair products to prepare for the summer season.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en: Olivier is age 31 and he is married to a house builder. He has sold vegetables for seven years. With the loan he will buy more tomatoes, eggplants and cabbages. He has a plan to use the profits to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, eggplants and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is taking another loan of Ksh 60,000 to start another business of operating a cafe. With the loan, she will be able to purchase wheat flour and sugar for her café, and clothing materials for her tailoring business. She tells how the previous loan enabled her to increase her profits, which accrued to make her start another business, and that her family's living standards have greatly improved.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar for her café, and clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with 3 children, all of whom attend school. He rents a house which has both piped water and electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past 10 years, Victor has been operating a shop selling major commodities such as wheat flour, sugar, and bread to his neighbors. He also does farming as his alternate source of income. His major business challenge is thieves. He dreams of running a wholesale business where he could sell such commodities in bulk. 

With the KES 80,000 he wants to buy additional stock for his business, including bales of wheat flour and sacks of sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, bales of maize flour and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Rashid has been working hard to manage his salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand his business, Rashid has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more machines for use in the salon, and will help Rashid to generate greater profits and expand his business. Rashid hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another branch of the same business. 

Rashid is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rashid who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more machines for use in the salon

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has four children.

Moussa has owned a store since 2004, selling spare parts for cars. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is  well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to renovate and repair the walls of his store and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and repair the walls of his store and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Belancilla

texts.en: Belancilla is 54 years old. She has been a tailor for 27 years. She has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine. She wants to save her profits for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines for doing her business better.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla, 31, is married and has one child who is too young to attend school. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, he has been operating a shop and a motorcycle business, locally referred to as “bodaboda”. His major customers are the general public. Thieves pose a major challenge to his business. He dreams of buying a motor vehicle in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 he wants to purchase additional stock for his shop as well as to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, and sacks of sugar for his shop, and to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en: Aloys is aged 39. He is a father of three children who are between the ages of 8 and 12. He sells clothes and he has been doing this business for the past seven years. With the loan he wants to buy more clothes in large quantity for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a single woman with two children who are enrolled in school. She has rented a house that has both electricity and piped water. Gladys operates a café where she sells her food to the general public. She has been in this business for the last six years and she aspires to open a restaurant in future. She describes theft to be her major challenge, and food to be her greatest monthly expense. With the loan of Ksh. 40,000, she intends to add to her stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to add to her stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yassin

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them work.

Yassin has owned a workshop since 2004, where he repairs cars. He has sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.


He applied for a $2400 loan in order to extend his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to extend his workshop.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children.

Iyad has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1500 loan in order to purchase two fridges and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two fridges and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia operates a grocery shop. This she has done for eight years now. The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  She is married and has two children.   

Patricia uses her income to support the husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit,  Patricia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 41 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with one of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Robinah has been working hard to manage her small restaurant which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Robinah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods for cooking and will help Robinah to generate greater profits and expand her business. Robinah hopes that in the future she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Robinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods for cooking

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 27 years old, married, and has three children.

Abdallah has owned a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a “Youth loan” in order to expand the market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to expand the market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 26 years old, married and has one child.

Hussein has owned a store since 2010, selling traditional Iraqi men's clothing. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.


He is requesting $3000 as a “Youth loan” in order to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Assouma

texts.en: Assouma is 29 years old. She sells cows and has been in the business for 9 years. She is married to a mechanic and they have three children aged between 2 and 11 years. The loan will be used to buy more cows to sell while the profits from the business will be for savings.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice  is a petty trader and she sells  footwear, which she has done for 5 years. She  lives at  Aboadi  near  Takoradi.  Beatrice  is  married and has  2 childern.   She uses her income  to  assist her husband in paying their accomodation bills. Beatrice   will use her loan to purchase  footwear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop to enable her to  sell the footwear.

loans.use: to purchase  footwear to sell

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Said, 42, is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, Victor has been operating a shop selling both common food commodities and basic household items. He also does farming as his alternate source of income. His major business challenge is thieves. He dreams of running a wholesale business where he could sell such commodities in bulk. 

With the Kshs. 80,000 he wants to buy additional stock for his business including sacks of sugar and cereals. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, wheat flour, sacks of sugar and washing soap

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She operates a clothes-selling business and aspires to open a shop in the future. She is married to a technician who provides support for her livelihood. Fatuma lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. 

She sells her clothes from door-to-door, and describes the high cost of transport as being her major challenge. The loan of Ksh. 20,000 will enable her to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with a single child who is enrolled in school. She operates a bodaboda (motorcycle for transporting people) business and has been doing so for the last three years.  She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Alice dreams of buying a passenger vehicle in the future. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support. She intends to use the loan of Ksh. 25,000 to service her motorcycle.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma, 41, is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, Juma has been operating rental houses and a water kiosk, selling water to his neighbors.  His major business challenge is seasonality, as his water business goes down when it rains and people harvest water for their domestic use. He dreams of building more houses and owning a public vehicle. 

With the Kshs. 70,000 he wants to renovate his houses, as well as purchase a water pump. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses and purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 30 years old. She is married to a house builder. She sells fruits and has spent four years in the business. 

With the loan, she plans to buy more oranges and mangoes to sell because most people demand these fruits. The profits from her business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more oranges and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos variados como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y fideos, etc, 
Francisca trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio sacó adelante a su familia, Francisca quiere mantener y ampliar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. Por ello solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANKACHA”; de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Francisca is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She has a grocery store where she sells a variety of products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and noodles.  

Francisca works from 6am until 10pm, and through this business she has provided for her family.  Francisca wants to maintain and expand her grocery store business.  To do this she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale.

Francisca is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.  She belongs to the communal bank "Qorimankacha" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es:
Nemesio  es un hombre de 56 años de edad, estado civil casado, con 02 hijos menores a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Ex Aterrizaje Hualtaco del  distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 80 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Nemesio es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno y tiene instalado plantación de limón. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años aproximadamente; así mismo realiza en sus tiempos libres transporte de pasajeros, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Su cónyuge le apoya en sus actividades que realiza.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en mantenimiento  del cultivo  y compra de alimentos, vitaminas para sus animales, compra de llantas para su mototaxi, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nemesio is a 56 year-old man who is married and has 2 minor children in his care.  He lives in his own home with his wife and children.  His house is located in the Ex Aterrizaje Hualtaco settlement in Tambogrande district, and it has electricity.  He lives in a community that includes about 80 families.

Nemesio has a business raising small animals (sheep, goats, pigs and poultry) and selling them in the local market.  He is also a farmer who cultivates lemons on some land that he has.  He has been doing this work for about 12 years.  In addition to this, in his spare time he also provides passenger transportation services and he does this work very well.  His wife supports him with his businesses.

He is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that he will use to invest in the maintenance of his crops and to purchase feed and vitamins for his animals.  He will also buy tires for his mototaxi (a light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle).  This will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to maintain his crops, to buy feed and vitamins for his animals, and to buy new tires for his mototaxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is 49 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Abdu has been working hard to manage his small business repairing and selling radios.

To help expand his business, Abdu has requested a loan of 3000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add stock for resale, which will help Abdu generate greater profits and expand his business. Abdu hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another branch of the same business. 

Abdu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abdu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add stock for resale.

loans.name: Kulsumbai

texts.en: Kulsumbai is a married woman who has nine children, one of whom attends school. She operates a food stall and she sells her goods from door to door to the general public. She has been in the business for the last 10 years, and aspires to build some rental houses. Kulsumbai owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes food to be her greatest monthly expense. She also has rental houses as her other source of livelihood. Theft and seasonality are her major challenges. With the KES 50000, she intends to repair her rental houses.

loans.use: to repair her rental houses.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso is 43 years old. She is married and lives in Kakheti Region with her family; her husband Nugzar, a 19-year-old son and a 17-year-old daughter. Eliso has chronic health problems and she receives a relevant pension from the local government. Nugzar works as a worker in the village. Also the family owns a 0.25 hectare vineyard. Nugzar sells harvested grapes in the village. He earns on average 100 lari per month. The total average monthly income of the family is 170 lari, including Eliso’s pension. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Eliso requested credit for cultivation of the family-owned plot of land. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Nugzar and Eliso will sow maize on the plot. They will work hard during spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest in late summer. They will sell harvested maize on the local open market. Along with the abovementioned, Eliso plans to purchase a piglet. She will raise the piglet for 5-6 months and sell the grown pig for a higher price. Eliso will reinvest the profit in the same business to expand it. In the long term, the income of the family will increase and they will get the possibility of combating poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a piglet and to rent a tractor for land cultivation

loans.name: Idrisa

texts.en:
Idrisa is a 54-year-old business man. He is married with five children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

Idrisa owns a restaurant and has operated his business for 15 years. This has helped him to minimally support his family. Idrisa needs this loan to buy sodas and beer to sell.

He faces a problem of theft, and his business dream is to expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Sylvere

texts.en: Sylvere is 26 years old. He sells trousers and shirts for men. He has been in the business for five years. With the loan, he will buy more trousers and shirts to sell. He wants to buy a plot of land from the profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She operates a retail shop where she sells her goods. She has been in this business for the last two years. She joined Yehu to access loans to expand her business. Mary lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She aspires to open a wholesale business in the future. Mary describes food to be her greatest monthly expense. With the KES 50000 she intends to buy beans, sugar, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Фахриддин мужчина в возрасте 39 лет,он отец шестерых детей.Фахриддин с юности занимается куплей и продажей скота.По специальности он работает строителем, и хорошо зарабатывает, но данный доход является сезонным. Поэтому он занимается животноводством.Его жена домохозяйка и занимается только детьми и домашними делами. 
Уже девятый год Фахриддин кредитуется в организации, и смог увеличить свой оборот. На полученный кредит он планирует купить несколько голов породистых баранов.
texts.en:
Fahriddin is a 39-year-old man and a father of six children. Since his youth, Fahriddin has been buying and selling livestock. He is a construction worker by trade and has a good salary, but his income is seasonal, which is why he is also engaged in raising farm animals. Fahriddin's wife stays at home and spends all her time taking care of their children and the household.

Fahriddin has been taking loans from MDO Arvand, LLC for nine years and in that time has been able to increase the volume of his sales. He is planning to use this loan to buy several purebred sheep.

loans.use: to purchase several sheep

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEDINE, un des quartiers de la ville de SAN (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de tissus et de bijoux. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  2 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire DJENEBA (1ere femme à droite sur la photo) compte utilise son prêt pour acheter, 25 pièces de wax real, 15 Bazin moyen riche, 5 complets de Bazin riche et un carton de bijoux. DJENEBA s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, auprès des grossistes pour venir revendre à SAN dans son quartier    au comptant, en détail  en espèce et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 19.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt, dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who make up the DJEKAFO group average 40 years of age and 5 children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in Medine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of San (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali) and they know each other through family and neighborhood ties.  They buy and sell various goods such as condiments, fabrics and jewelry.

Having duly repaid two previous loans, the women of the DJEKAFO group are on their third solidarity loan.  DJENEBA (first woman from the right in the photo) is planning to use her loan to buy 25 sets of "real" wax fabrics, 15 sets of middle grade "bazin" (damasked) fabrics, 5 outfits made of high grade "bazin" and a box of jewelry.  She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Bamako and resells in her own neighborhood in San.  She sells for retail, for cash or on credit, to a customer base which consists of men and women.

Djeneba is expecting average monthly profits to reach 19,000 CFA francs which will be used to repay her loan and take care of healthcare, food and tuition expenses, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as fabrics and jewelry.

loans.name: Tursunboy

texts.ru: Турсунбой жизнерадостный,пунктуальный мужчина в возрасте 40 лет,женат и имеет троих детей.Проживает в районе Спитамен.В центре района имеет вулканизацию.У него хороший опыт и много постоянных клиентов в бизнесе.Ещё он дома откармливает малого рогатого скота.В этом бизнесе ему помогает его жена Феруза и дети. С 2008 года Турсунбой кредитуется в организации "Арванд" и доказал свою честность.С целью расширения услуг для своих клиентов Турсунбой на очередной займ хочет купить оборудования для вулканизации.Оборудование стоит 5000 сомони и ему не хватает 3500 сомони.Он надеется на вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Tursunboy is a cheerful and punctual man of 40 years. He is married and has three children. Tursunboy lives in the Spitamen region and runs his tire vulcanization service in the region's centre. He has significant experience in this business, and many steady customers. Additionally, he raises livestock at home, with help from his wife Feruza and their children.

Tursunboy has been taking loans from MDO Arvand, LLC since 2008 and has proven to be an honest client. In order to expand the range of services he offers his customers, Tursunboy would like to use his new loan to purchase tire vulcanization equipment. This equipment costs 5000 somoni, and Tursunboy needs 3500 somoni to afford it. He is hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for tire vulcanization

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his business, and will help Godfrey to generate and realize greater profits. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to increase more capital and customers. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
Humu is a single parent who has one child. Humu is a petty trader, and has been selling footwear for five years. She lives at Aboadi near Takoradi.  As a single parent, she uses her income to pay her child’s school fees. 

Humu will use her loan to purchase footwear to sell. With the new profit, Humu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells locally made soap at Aboadzi near Takoradi. She has been selling this type of soap for 4 years now. She is married to a teacher and has 4 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase raw materials to produce her soap for sale. With the new profit, Elizabeth will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to produce her soap for sale

loans.name: Sadat

texts.en:
Sadat is 27 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Sadat has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Sadat has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like soap and salt for resale, and will help Sadat to generate greater profits and expand his business. Sadat hopes that in the future he will be able to increase more stock and profits. 

Sadat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sadat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like soap and salt for resale.

loans.name: Narynkul

texts.ru: Нарынкул 28 лет, воспитывает сына.   В 2005 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Нарынкул начала свой бизнес в торговле головными уборами, стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Нарынкул сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Нарынкул  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Нарынкул  планирует частично вложить в ремонт квартиры, и часть – в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Narynkul is 28 years old, she is raising a son. In 2005, while looking for a source of income for her family, Narynkul launched her own business selling hats with a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Narynkul was able to develop her business so that it currently earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Presently, the variety of hats for sale is not very wide, and so Narynkul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to expand the assortment of goods in her shop. She plans to use a part of her profits from this loan to perform repairs in her apartment, and to invest the other part into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods in her shop

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
El señor Leopoldo es originario de san jerónimo municipio de Teustepe, casado padre de 7 hijos todos mayores de edad todos ellos estudiaron hasta la primaria. El inicio  su actividad ayudando a otro productores, pues  tenía que trabajar para ayudar a su mama a la edad de 15 años empezó sembrando 1/2 manzana de frijol y 1 manzana de maíz para el consumo ya a la edad 20 años empezó a producir más frijol y se dedico a vender su producto sembrando de 2 a 3 manzanas de frijol siendo esta su única actividad, posteriormente se dedico también a trabajar con la crianza de cerdos para vender, con préstamos y esfuerzos propios ha comprado tierra y ganado sus hijos lo apoyan, su producto lo vende en Managua  le gustaría vender en otro lugar su producto donde ofrezcan un mejor precio, le ha ido bastante bien aunque en ocasiones se pierde por problemas climático. 
El préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar 1 vaca, pagar mano de obra para la siembra. Este crédito le  ayudara comprar  insumos para  preparar mejor sus aéreas de siembra y  así obtener  mejores resultados. Su planes futuro comprar más tierra y ganado para tener otro ingreso, su meta próxima es sembrar 4 a 5 manzana de frijol y maíz.
texts.en:
Señor Leopoldo is from San Jerónimo in the municipality of Teusepe. He is married and is the father of 7 children, all of whom are adults. They all went to school through primary school. He began his work by helping other farmers because he had to work to help his mother. At the age of 15 he began planting one-half manzana of beans and 1 manzana of corn for consumption (one manzana is about 1.75 acres). By the age of 20 he began to produce more beans and he sold his products, planting 2 or 3 manzanas of beans, since this was his only work. Later he also began to raise pigs to sell. With loans and through his own efforts he has bought land and livestock. His children help him. He sells his products in Managua. He would like to sell in his products in another location where they offer better prices. It has gone well enough for him, even though he sometimes has losses due to weather problems.

He is applying for the loan to buy a cow and to pay for labor for planting. This loan will help him buy supplies to better prepare his planting areas and thus obtain better results. His future plans are to buy more land and livestock to have another income. His next goal is to plant 4 to 5 manzanas of beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy a cow and pay for labor for planting

loans.name: Maro

texts.ru:
Маро занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом на протяжении 20 лет. В деревне Шишкерт, Сюникского региона, Маро разводит крупный рогатый скот и кур, выращивает картофель и яблоки на продажу. Яблоки, картофель, говядину, молоко и яйца она продает в городах Капане и Каджаране, где всегда большой спрос на сельскохозяйственную продукцию. Благодаря выручке, получаемой от занятия сельским хозяйством, Маро содержит семью. 
Маро 44 года. Она замужем и у нее 2 дочери. Маро окончила педагогический университет и, параллельно, с занятием сельскохозяйственным бизнесом, она работает учительницей биологии в школе.
