Младшая дочь Маро также работает учительницей в сельской школе, старшая дочь находится в процессе поиска работы; муж Маро помогает ей в ведении сельского хозяйства. 
Маро получала кредит от организации Нор Оризон 3 раза и всегда выплачивала кредит во время. Сейчас Маро необходимо 500.000 драм для покупки рассады нового сорта картофеля в преддверии посевного сезона.
texts.en:
Maro has been in the agriculture business for 20 years. In the village of Shishkert, Syuniksk region, Maro raises cattle and chickens, and grows potatoes and apples for sale. She sells the apples, potatoes, beef, milk and eggs in the cities of Kapan and Kadzharan, where there is always high demand for farmers' products. Maro provides for her family thanks to her profits from this business.

Maro is 44 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters. Maro graduated from teachers' university and, in addition to running her agriculture business, works as a school biology teacher. Her youngest daughter is also a school teacher in a rural area, while her oldest daughter is currently looking for work. Maro's husband helps her with farming. Maro has received 3 loans from Nor Horizon, and have always repaid them on time. Presently, she needs 500,000 dram to purchase seedlings of a new sort of potatoes in time for the sowing season.

loans.use: to buy potato seedling ahead of the sowing season

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es: Maria Jacinta tiene 36 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes les ofrece su producto, en su casa de habitación también tiene mercadería que les ofrece a sus vecinos que son clientes de ella, esta emprendedora tiene tres hijos en el cual está todavía están a su cargo y su mayor sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios. Esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisas, blúmer, sandalias, camisas entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Maria Jacinta is 36 years old. Her work is selling merchandise in general. She does this as a walking vendor. She now has regular and occasional customers to whom she offers her products. She also has merchandise in her home that she offers to her neighbors who are her customers. This entrepreneur has three children who are still in her care, and her greatest dream is that her children finish school. This entrepreneur is applying for financing for the purchase of products such as pants, shirts, bloomers, sandals, and blouses, among other items that her customers ask her for.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, bloomers, sandals, and blouses, among other products that her customers ask for.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells palm fruit. She has been in this business for six years now. She lives together with her husband and two children at Aboadze near Takoradi. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

Comfort will use her loan to purchase palm fruit to sell. With the new profit, she wants to be one of the distributors of palm fruit in her town.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit to sell.

loans.name: Donita

texts.en: Donita is a single woman who sells new clothes, rice, and shoes from her home. She has been doing so for the last 10 years. Other sources of livelihood come from her brothers who are working. Donita lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She dreams of opening a wholesale shop in the future, and she describes high transport costs and theft to be her major drawbacks. She plans to use the loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy bundles of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a widow. She has 3 children, and she operates a grocery shop at Aboadzi near Takoradi, which she has done for 15 years now.   The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.   Elizabeth uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profits, Elizabeth plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 7 children.  Zulaika has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Zulaika has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Zulaika to generate greater profits and boost the business. Zulaika hopes that in the future she will be able to import the goods by herself from outside countries. 

Zulaika is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zulaika who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 34 years old. She is married with one child. She sells shoes and has been selling shoes for ten years. With the profits, she will provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  es un hombre de 38 años de edad, estado civil casado, con 02 hijos menores a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Pedregal Alto  del distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Manuel es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno y tiene instalado plantación de limón. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años aproximadamente; es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Su cónyuge le apoya en sus actividades que realiza.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en  la compra de fertilizantes, mantenimiento  del cultivo  y compra de alimentos, vitaminas para sus animales,  lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 27 years old, married and two sons. He lives in his own house with his wife and two sons. The house is located in Caserio Pedregal Alto in Tambogrande´s district. His house has electricity and is located in a small community of approximately 100 families.

Manuel makes  makes a living raising and selling small livestock (sheep, goats, pigs, goats and poultry), which he sells in the local market. He also makes a living farming. He has his own land, where he has a lemon plantation. He has been doing this for the last 10 years approximately, that is to say, that he knows it to the perfection. His wife helps him with these activities. 

The amount of the requested loan is 2000 new soles, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, maintain the plantation and purchase food and vitamins for his animals, which will allow him to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, maintain the plantation and purchase food and vitamins for his animals.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano, es originario de la comunidad Zapote, en las afueras de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, casado, padre de tres hijos de 20 ,18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, dos de ellos esta estudiando la universidad y el ultimo está estudiando en la escuela cercana a su comunidad,  el es de oficio agricultor se dedica  a la siembre  desde muy joven. Empezó a trabajar con crédito de manera individual en otras instituciones financieras pero después decidió trabajar de manera individual, el nos expresa atravez de los prestamos el logrado mejorar su casa, comprado tierras y vendido sus cosechas, el es muy dinámico y emprendedor además de sembrar tiene una pequeña pulpería en la cual vende arroz, azúcar, aceite ,café.   
Feliciano está solicitando el crédito para la compra de trigo el cual es un producto muy solicitado por sus clientes y además podrá almacenar para cuando se presenta la escases de este producto y no dejar de venderlo. Dentro de sus planes esta prepararse para el siguiente ciclo de siembra de arroz y frijoles y comprar unas vacas en la medida de lo posible.
texts.en:
Feliciano is from the town of Zapote on the outskirts of Teustepe in the Boaco municipality.  He is married and the father of three children who are 20, 18, and 12-years-old respectively.  Two of his children are studying in the university and the last one is studying in a school near their town.  He works in agriculture and has been growing crops since he was very young.  He began using loans independently with other financial institutions but later decided to work with this group on an individual basis.  He tells us that through these loans he has managed to improve his house, buy land, and sell his harvests.  He is very energetic and entrepreneurial; as well as growing crops he has a small store where he sells rice, sugar, oil, and coffee.  

Feliciano is requesting the loan to buy wheat which is a product that is often requested by his customers.  Also, he will be able to store some for when this product is scarce so as to not stop selling it.  His plans include preparing for the next planting cycle for rice and beans and buying some cows if the opportunity presents itself.

loans.use: to buy wheat.

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en:
Geogina is a food vendor.  She cooks banku for sale, and she serves it with okro and fish stew at Aboadzi near Takoradi. She has done this for 4 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband works with the Benso Oil plantation. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish that she will use in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish that she will use in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA ont  en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Dallan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de légumes, d’habits de poissons et de la restauration. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1ER  prêt solidaire.
Madame,   SAFIATOU  (deuxième femme debout de gauche vers la droite sur la photo) excelle dans la préparation et vente de beignets. Elle est très sollicitée dans le village de Dallan et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  300 kg de riz décortique deux bidons de vingt litres d huile  un paquet de levure au grand marche de San. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes à la porte de son domicile. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  SAFIATOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotognogotala group, all married women living mainly in traditional extended families and averaging 44 years of age, with four children. They all live in the village of Dallan in the Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their work. They sell vegetables, clothing, fish, and cooked food. 
With the goal of meeting growing demand and their customers’ expectations, the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program, and are on their first solidarity loan.

Mrs. Safiatou (the second one standing from the left in the photo) has a successful business cooking and selling fritters. She is very much in demand in the village of Dallan and the nearby area. She plans to use her loan to buy 300 kg [660 lbs] of dehusked rice, two 20-liter [about 5.3 gallons] jugs of vegetable oil and a pack of yeast at the big market of San. She sells by her house entrance retail, for cash, by the entrance to a diverse customer base. 

Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Safiatou hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 13,000 West African Francs, which will be used to reinvestein the business and help her husband provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for making fritters.

loans.name: Bohirjon

texts.ru: Бохиржон 1953 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Он сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2008 года. Бохиржон занимается откормом скота 24 года. Также он работает  мастером ремонтных услуг, проводит ремонт помещений. Его старший сын находиться в Российской Федерации и каждые 2-3 месяца присылает ему деньги. Но присылаемая  сумма делится на две семьи потому что у его сына тоже есть жена и дети. Этих денег не  хватает им на проживание. Поэтому Бохиржон старается сам развивать свой бизнес и копит на жизнь. В настоящее время благодарен за финансовую поддержку от КИВА и на полученный  кредит хочет купить  скот.
texts.en: Bohirjon was born in 1953. He is married and has five children. He has been collaborating with organization since 2008. Bohirjon has been raising livestock for 24 years. He also provides home repair services. His oldest son is now in the Russian Federation, sending him some money every two or three months. Yet the amount sent by his son is divided between two families, because his son also has a wife and children. The money is insufficient to support them all. This is why Bohirjon tries to grow his own business and save some money for his expenses. At present he thanks Kiva for financial support and plans to use his loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati operates a food stall where she sells her goods to the general public. She has been doing this for the past three years. She wants to open a restaurant in the future and she describes theft and seasonality as her major challenges. Her other source of livelihood includes earnings from her husband who is a businessman.

Bahati lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. With this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she plans to buy rice and wheat flour for her food stall.

loans.use: to buy rice and wheat flour for her food stall.

loans.name: María Dinora

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 40 años de edad, tiene dos hijos uno de 16 años y otro de dos años de edad. Ella tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como son: blusas, camisas, pantalones y faldas. Ese oficio lo aprendió gracias a que asistió a un taller de enseñanza de corte y confección.  Actualmente existe un proyecto coordinado con los centros escolares y el Gobierno Central que aporta los uniformes a los estudiantes de los centros escolares en el país. Ella esta elaborando 80 uniformes escolares completos de la escuela en donde ella vive. 

Maria compra los materiales para la elaboración de las prendas en un centro que esta a medio kilómetro de su casa en donde venden telas al por mayor y los demás accesorios como los ojales, botones, hilo, ziper, remaches, entre otros.

Por esa razón necesita el préstamo para comprar 120 yardas de tela color azul, 100 yardas de tela color blanco, 25 conos de hilo, 80 ziper, 500 botones, etc. De esta manera ella elaborara las prendas de vestir y surtir la demanda  existente, obteniendo mayores ingresos.

Maria desea comprar otra maquina de coser, por que la que tiene ya no le da abasto debido a la demanda existente.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old. She has two children, one aged 16 and one who is two years old. For more than 10 years, she has worked making clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants and skirts. She learned this profession thanks to her attendance at a workshop teaching tailoring skills. Currently, there is a project coordinated among the schools and the central government which provides uniforms to the students in the country's schools. Maria is making 80 complete school uniforms for the school in the area where she lives. 

Maria buys the materials to make her garments at a center which is half a kilometer from her house, where cloth is sold wholesale, along with other accessories such as grommets, buttons, thread, zippers, rivets, and others. 

For this reason, she needs the loan to buy 120 yards of blue fabric, 100 yards of white fabric, 25 cones of thread, 80 zippers, 500 buttons, etc. In this way, she will make clothing and cover the existing demand, earning a better income. 

Maria's desire is to buy another sewing machine, because the one she has does not allow her to build up enough inventory, due to the existing demand.

loans.use: to buy 120 yards of blue fabric, 100 yards of white fabric, 25 cones of thread, 80 zippers, 500 buttons, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  es un hombre de 41 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Monte Azul, distrito de la Matanza y no cuenta con servicio básicos, el lugar es  de aproximadamente 60 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Francisco es el servicio de mototaxi (transporte de pasajeros), así como a la cría y venta de animales menores como caprinos, porcinos y aves de corral y lo comercializar en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente su cónyuge le apoya en la crianza de sus animales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1208 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y compra de soat, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Francisco is a 41-year-old man and is in a common law marriage with 2 children.  He lives in his own home with his wife and children.  His home is located in the town of Monte Azul in the district of La Matanza.  It doesn't have basic services and has about 60 families.  He has a motorcycle taxi service and transports passengers.  He also raises and sells small animals like goats, pigs, and poultry to sell at the local market.  He has done this work for approximately 5 years.  He learned it from his parents, which is to say he knows it to perfection.  His wife also helps him raise the animals.  The requested loan is for 1,208 PEN, which he will use to provide maintance for his motorcycle taxi and to buy SOAT (vehicle insurance), which will let him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy SOAT (vehicle insurance) and maintenance for his vehicle.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una mujer de 57 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 01 hijo menor a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan  del distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 90 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Gregoria es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años aproximadamente; es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Su cónyuge es agricultor con parcela propia en la cual tiene instalado mango, donde ella le envía dinero para que compre la fruta; donde viene apoyándole en sus gastos familiares.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de alimento para engorde y vitaminas para sus animales,  lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 57-year-old married woman with one dependent child.  She lives in her own house with her husband and children.  The house is located in a rural area of the Santa Rosa de Curvan village in the Tambogrande district and has electricity.  It is a community of about 90 families.

Gregoria works breeding small animals (sheep, goats, pigs, and poultry) which she sells in the local market.  She has worked in this for 12 years and thus knows the system perfectly.  Her husband is a farmer with his own piece of land where he grows money.  She sends him money to buy the fruit and he helps support the family’s expenses.  

The loan amount she is requesting is 2000 nuevos soles which will be used to buy high energy feed and vitamins for her animals which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy high energy feed and vitamins for her animals.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is aged 44. She is a mother of five children. She sells different items in a shop. With the loan she plans to buy more beans, cooking oil and rice to sell. She dreams to build a house from the profits that she will get from the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell, such as beans and rice.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es: Gerardo tiene 27 años de edad y es originario de una población rica en historia y donde la gente es amable y muy cálida. El es parte del grupo llamado Sol, dice que lo invitaron unas amigas a formar parte del grupo porque  saben que es responsable y tiene la solvencia moral y económica para pagar un crédito. El tiene una carpintería y hace muebles para vender como mesas, sillas, marcos para cuadros, alacenas, bancos, camas, roperos, y muchos tipos de muebles más. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de material para hacer sus muebles, dice que quiere comprar madera, pegamento, barniz en diferentes colores, clavos, taquetes, agarraderas, chapas etc. Dice que los muebles que  hace van hasta su casa a comprarlos que ya tiene clientes quienes los vende en otros lugares del estado. Dice que su negocio es familiar ya que está asociado con un primo el cual es el que le enseño hacer los muebles. Una de sus metas es hacer su propia carpintería y comprar sus maquinas para poder hacer sus muebles. Los otros once integrantes se llaman Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura, Argelia, Susana, América, Karen Alejandra, Emanuel, Gloria Patricia, Narcedalia, Karen Alejandra ellos invertirán su crédito en la compra de artículos para una papelería, en un club nutricional, en la compra de ropa interior por catalogo, en la compra de ropa para dama y caballero, en la compra de insumos para vender tacos de bistec, chorizo, tripa, compra de colchas, sabanas por catalogo, para la compra de frutas y verduras de temporada, para la compra de refresco para vender en depósito, en material para un taller de costura y en una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Gerardo is 27-years-old and is from a town rich in history where the people are friendly and very warm.  He is part of a group called Sol (Sun) and says that he was invited to be part of the group by some friends because they know that he is responsible and has the moral and economic wherewithal to pay a loan back.  He has a carpentry shop and makes furniture to sell like tables, chairs, picture frames, cabinets, benches, beds, dressers, and many other kinds of furniture.  He says that he is requesting a loan from the organization to buy materials to make his furniture.  He would like to buy wood, glue, varnish in different colors, nails, wall anchors, handles, panels, etc.  The furniture he makes, even that in his house, goes to be sold as he has customers who sell them in other parts of the state.  His business is a family business as he works with a cousin who taught him how to make furniture.  One of his goals is to open his own carpentry shop and to buy the machines he needs to make his furniture.  The other 11 members are Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura, Argelia, Susana, América, Karen Alejandra, Emanuel, Gloria Patricia, and Narcedalia.  They will use the loan to buy items for a stationery store, for a nutritional club, to buy underwear through a catalog supplier, to buy women’s and men’s clothing, to buy supplies for selling tacos with steak, sausage, and tripe, to buy bedspreads and sheets from a catalog supplier, to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables, to buy sodas to sell in a store, to buy materials for a sewing workshop, and to buy supplies for a grocery store.

loans.use: buy wood, glue, varnish in different colors, nails, wall anchors, handles, panels etc.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina produces palm oil for sale; she also sells palm fruit. She has been in this business for four years now. She lives together with her husband and two children in Aboadzi near Takoradi. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their children’s school fees. 

Sabina will use her loan to purchase palm fruit to sell and to produce her palm oil for sale. With the new profit, she wishes to buy a machine for the production of her oil for sale.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit to sell and to produce her palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Franscisca

texts.en:
Franscisca is married to a businessman and has three children, all of whom are attending school. She has been selling charcoal for the last three years, and she describes that she joined Yehu to get financial support. 

Franscisca lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Food is her major monthly expense, and she aspires to establish a charcoal depot in the future. High cost of transport is her major business drawback. With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she plans to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 31 years old. He has one child who is four years old. He sell clothes and has spent 12 years in the business. He wants to buy more trousers and sweaters to sell with this loan. Profits from the business will be used to buy a residential house.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es: La Sra. Ana  es viuda, tiene 41 años  de edad y tiene 4 hijos, actualmente  es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “Las Palmeras” grupo  conformado por  10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Ana  se dedica a la venta de ropa  a  domicilio  desde hace 10 años, a su vez también se dedica a la artesanía ya que elabora ollas de arcilla y los vende en el meracdo, este negocio surge con la idea de obtener mejores ingresos económicos ya que a raíz del fallecimiento de su esposo tuvo  que trabajar mas duro para sacar  adelante a sus hijos, hoy en día ya cuenta con clientes fidelizados, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a, ha construido su casa y sus hijos tienen educación , Ana  solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería prendas de vestir (polos, pantalones, blusas). Ana cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los prestamos de edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en: Ana is a 41-year-old widow who has four children.  She is currently a member of a communal bank called “Las Palmeras” (The Palm Trees).  This group is made up of 10 members who work in a variety of business types.  Ana has worked selling clothing from her home for ten years and also sometimes works as an artisan making clay pots which she sells in the market.  This business came about as a way to make more income as after her husband’s death she had to work harder to get ahead with her children.  Now she had loyal customers and, thanks to her effort and dedication, has built her house and has educated children.  Ana is requesting a new loan to buy clothing merchandise (polo shirts, pants, and blouses).  Ana will accomplish her goals with much work and effort and the loans from edaprospo have helped her.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise (polo shirts, pants, and blouses).

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is a woman who is married to a businessman and has two children, both enrolled in school. For the past 20 years, she has been selling fish at the market, and she describes seasonality as her challenge. Other sources of income include the earnings of her husband. Bahati's goal is to open a shop in the future and she decided to join Yehu to get financial facilities. With the Ksh 30,000, she intends to buy more fish for sale. Bahati owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 29 years old. She sells (cell phone) air time. She has been in the business for the past two years. She wants to buy more air time for sale and the profits from the business will be used to buy a house for residence.

loans.use: To buy more airtime for sale

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina lives together with the husband and 2 children at Aboadzi near Takoradi.  Augustina operates a grocery shop which she has done for a number of years now. The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of soft drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, tin milk and others. Augustina uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 28 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Amina has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her business, and will help Amina to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to become a big supplier. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Bessik

texts.en:
Bessik is 47 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his 6-year-old daughter and mother (retired). Bessik has a milk cow. His mother produces cheese and sells it in the village to local dairy product retailers. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Bessik requested credit for re-starting to trade in cement. He used to trade in cement for 7 years, but stopped the operations, as he didn’t have turnover means. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Bessik will purchase cement from producer factories at wholesale prices and sell it in the district with a price mark-up. Bessik has good contacts in this field and will use them in setting up his business. The income of the family will increase and the living conditions will significantly improve. The family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase cement for resale

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is 23 years old. She is married with one child. Her husband works as a businessman. She has been selling trousers for five years. She wants the loan to buy more trousers for sale. With the profits, she plans to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more trousers for sale

loans.name: Florentina Sayultepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Florentina Sayultepec esta integrado por nueve mujeres trabajadoras e indígenas con deseos de superación y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de un pueblo llamado  San Francisco Sayultepec  un pueblo pequeño  donde hay muchos árboles verdes y grandes  a la orilla hay un río que  divide a su pueblo con un pequeño pueblo llamado Ipalapa.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo se llama  Florentina de cincuenta y siete años de edad  tiene cinco hijos  quienes ya están casados.
Nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta y elaboración de  artesanías como son huipiles, manteles  y servilletas.
Nos cuenta que se va a vender su mercancía en las colonias de su comunidad y  en Acapulco se va una semana a vender y se queda con sus familiares.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  coser y bordar ya que desde muy pequeña le ha gustado  por su mama se dedicaba a lo mismo.
Uno de los retos que le impiden seguir con su negocio es que  en ocasiones vende muy poco pero también vende mucho, pero cuando no tiene ventas se  desanima mucho y se pone triste.
Ella pidió el crédito para la compra de mas material para la elaboración de mas huipiles, servilletas y huipiles como son: manta, ajugas, listones, hilos para cose e hilos de cristal.
Nos cuenta que con sus ganancias va orar para operarse el piel  ya que desde hace tres meses se lo fracturo, pero gracias a dios a tenido buenas ganancias  para operase el pie y ya le cueste trabajo caminar rápido.
Esta muy agradecida con fundación por ayudarla para que pueda seguir con su negocio y sobre todo por ayudar a sus compañeras para que puedan engrandecer sus negocios y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Rosalía- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Edith- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Eugenia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juana- se dedica a la venta de quesos.
María de la Luz- se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Floriberta- se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Lucia- se   dedica a la venta de bordados.
Araceli- se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a que  su vida mejore cada día mas.
texts.en:
This group is called Florentina Sayultepec. It consists of nine members who are hard-working indigenous women with the desire to overcome and improve their quality of life. The members of the group are from a town called San Francisco Sayultepec, a little town where there are many large green trees. On the edge is a river that divides their town from a little town called Ipalapa.

One of the members of this group is Florentina, who is 57 years old. She has five children who are already married. She tells us that her work is making and selling handicrafts, such as blouses, tablecloths, and napkins. She tells us that she goes out to sell her merchandise in the neighborhoods of her community, and she goes to sell in Acapulco for a week and stays with her relatives. What she likes most about her business is sewing and embroidering, since she has liked to do this since she was very young, because her mother did the same work. One of the challenges that impedes her from continuing with her business is that sometimes she sells very little, but she also sells a lot, but when she doesn't have sales she becomes discouraged and sad. She is applying for the loan to buy more materials to make more blouses, napkins, and tablecloths, such as tablecloths, needles, ribbons, sewing thread, and strings of beads. She tells us that she is going to save her earnings for an operation on her foot, since she fractured it three months ago, but thanks to God she has had good earnings for the operation on her foot since it is hard for her to walk rapidly. She is thankful to the foundation for helping her so that she can continue with her business and above all for helping her companions so that they can enlarge their businesses and improve their quality of life.

The other members of the group are Rosalia, who sells clothing; Edith, who sells groceries; Eugenia, who sells Mexican snacks; Juana, who sells cheese; Maria de la Luz, who sells embroidery; Floriberta, who sells embroidery; Lucia, who sells embroidery; and Araceli, who sells embroidery. They give thanks to the foundation for helping them so that their lives get better every day.

loans.use: to buy material to make tablecloths, blouses, and napkins

loans.name: Asiat

texts.en:
Asiat is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Asiat has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells items such as sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Asiat has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Asiat to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Asiat hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Asiat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asiat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 4 of them currently in school. Billy has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Billy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for resale, and will help Billy to generate greater profits and expand his business. Billy hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another branch of the same business. 

Billy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Billy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Reebok Group

texts.en:
Msafiri, who is in his early 30s is single.  He has been selling chips for one year now. He works from 11:00 am to after midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes, bought a mattress, household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan to buy still more sacks of Irish potatoes for making more chips to sell.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Reebok" which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes for making more chips to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina sells clothes and ladies' wear at Aboazi near Takoradi. She is a single parent with one child. She uses her income to pay her child’s school fees. Christina will use her loan to purchase clothes and ladies' wear to sell. With the new profit, she will acquire a shop to make her selling easy.

loans.use: purchase clothes and ladies' wear to sell

loans.name: Kwale Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her late 20's, is divorced with three children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania; she wants to use it to increase her stock of food to sell to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kwale" that has a total of 15 members. Each member will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the stock of food to sell to more people.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells accessories for women at Aboadi near Takoradi; she has done this for three years now. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of their family. Rebecca will use her loan to purchase a variety of accessories to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of accessories to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives with her husband, who is a driver, and three children in Aboadzi near Takoradi. Mercy is a petty trader; she sells groceries and bread, which she has done for five years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school frees. 

Mercy will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers and also to buy flour and sugar to bake the bread to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hairdresser. She owns a beauty salon in Aboadzi near Takoradi. Florence has completed junior high school. She is married. Her husband is a carpenter.  

Florence has been a hairdresser for five years. She uses her income to support her husband with paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther owns this grocery shop. She sells other food items as well, which she has done for four years now. Esther is married with four children. Her husband is a driver. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying her children’s school fees.  

Esther will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery and food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery and food items to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre de 31 años de edad, estado civil soltero, Vive  en casa  propia  con su s padres. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío El Seis del  distrito de Oyotùn y cuenta con servicio de luz, agua, desagüe, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 400 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Marco es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno  (2.5 has) y tiene instalado arroz variedad Fortaleza de 70 días después de la siembra, donde presenta buen desarrollo fenològico. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 7 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 4000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en  la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, bioestimulantes y pago de jornales   del cultivo  y compra de alimentos, vitaminas para sus animales, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
31-year-old Marco is single and lives at home with his parents. Their house is in El Seis in the district of Oyotun, with amenities including electricity, water, and drainage. This area is a community of about 400 families.

Marco raises small animals (sheep, goats, pigs and poultry), which he sells in the local market. He is also a farmer and owns his own land (2.5 hectares), where he has planted rice. He fertilizes the rice 70 days after planting, when it shows good phenological development. He has been doing this for about 7 years, and learned from his parents - it is said that he knows his trade perfectly. 

Marco is seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000 soles, which will be used to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides, bio-stimulants, to pay wages for the farm labour, and buy food and vitamins for his animals, allowing him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, bio-stimulants, and to pay wages for the farm labour

loans.name: Amnatu

texts.en:
Amnatu sells secondhand ladies and children's dresses. She has been selling secondhand dresses for three years now.   

Amnatu is married; her husband is a driver. She uses her income to support her husband with paying their utility and accommodation bills. 

Amnatu needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, Amnatu plan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba is divorced. She has five dependents to care for. Abiba is a fishmonger; she buys fresh fish from the market to smoke and sell in Aboadzi near Takoradi. Abiba has been in this business for 15 years now. As a single parent, she uses her income for the general upkeep of her family. Abiba  will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. Abiba will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a seamstress at Aboadi near Takoradi. She has been a seamstress for five years now. Lydia is married with two children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay for their accommodation and utility bills. Lydia will use her loan to purchase fabric to make dresses to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make dresses to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a food vendor; she cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Aboadzi near Takoradi. Rose is married and has four children. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She uses her income to support her husband to feed, cloth, and pay for their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit, Rose plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret is a fishmonger; she sells smoked fish in Aboadi near Takoradi.  Magaret  has been selling smoked fish for three years now. She is married with two children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Magaret will use her loan to purchase smoked fish to sell. Magaret will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Cristina es una señora responsable muy dedicada a su trabajo , cuenta con 44 años de edad es casada, Gaudencio su esposo se dedica  a hacer tabicones, lo cual tienen 3 hijos, Andrea de 4 años cursa 1° del preescolar, Leonel tiene 7 años y cursa 1° de primaria y Diana de 14 años cursa 2° de secundaria.
Cristina es muy trabajadora y tiene un puesto donde vende Cena, donde tiene variedad de Antojitos Mexicanos como son: Tacos Dorados, Picaditas, Enchiladas apenas empezó con su negocio tiene 5 meses con él, lo que cuenta que le va muy bien y que con el préstamo piensa en comprar más ingredientes para preparar sus guisos de los Antojitos,  ella piensa que si más variedad tiene puede ganar el doble de sus ganancias y quiere seguir saliendo adelante, cuenta que con sus ganancias podría hacerse un local más grande y tener una buena presentación de su negocio y atraer más clientes. 
Cristina junto con 8 mujeres trabajadoras y 2 hombre  más integran el Grupo Primavera, a continuación se mencionarán: Cristina, Xochitl, Ormisda, Bacilia, Severiano, Mónica, Cleofás, Juana, Ofelia, Rocío, Alberto, se dedican a la venta de: Comida, Productos de Abarrotes, Ropa,  Pan, Productos de Mercería y Piñatas. Dando gracias al apoyo que se les brinda.
texts.en:
44-year-old Cristina is a very responsible lady who is dedicated to her work. She is married and her husband Gaudencio makes breeze blocks. They have 3 children: Andrea, 4, is in the first year of preschool, Leonel is 7 and attends primary 1, and 14-year-old Diana attends secondary school.

Cristina is hardworking and has a stand where she sells suppertime meals. She serves a variety of Antojitos Mexicanos (corn-based Mexican dishes) such as as tacos, snacks and enchiladas. She started her business just over 5 months ago, and she says that is doing very well and with the loan she is considering buying more ingredients to prepare her dishes. Cristina thinks that if she offers more variety she could double her profits, and she wants to keep moving forward. She believes that she can increase her profits, present her business well and attract more customers.

Cristina, along with 8 women and 2 men, make up the working up the Primavera communal bank. These are: Cristina, Xochitl, Ormisda, Bacilia, Severiano, Mónica, Cleofás, Juana, Ofelia, Rocío, and Alberto who sell the following: food produce, groceries, clothing, bread, haberdashery and piñatas. They are thankful for the support they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare her dishes such as chicken, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.ru: Тухфа - женщина в возрасе 48 лет, мать троих детей. Она вместе с сыном выезжает на рынке по районам. Продаёт ткани и продукты питания. Раньше при первом займе она торговала только продуктами питания, а теперь постепенно смогла увеличить свой ассортимент товаров и включила ткани  для пошива постелей. На следующий кредит она собирается оптом закупить товар и развозить его по рынкам Ганчинского района.
texts.en: Tuhfa is a 48-year-old woman and the mother of three children.  With her son, she goes to markets in various districts to sell fabrics and food products at the market.  When she took her first loan, she used to sell food products only, but she has gradually increased her assortment of merchandise and now also sells fabrics for bedding.  With this next loan, she is planning to buy some merchandise in bulk and deliver it to the markets of the Ghonchi district.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in bulk and expand her business.

loans.name: Nazirakan

texts.ru:
Назиракан 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Назиракан с 1992 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Назиракан имеется 2 коровы, 6 телят, 2 бычка и 2 лошадь, а  также 0,5 га земли, где она выращивает клевер и кукурузу. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назиракан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Назиракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nazirakan is 40 years old, married, and raising five children. To provide a primary source of income, for her family, she has been working in animal husbandry since 1992, starting her business with an initial amount of 2,000 som (KGS).  Today, Nazirakan's farming business consists of two cows, six calves, two young bulls and two horses.  She also owns half an hectare of land where she grows corn and clover.

In order to further expand her business, Nazirakan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 125,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock, specifically young animals.  She is planning to invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina  is a seamstress  at  Aboadzi  near Takoradi. She has been a seamstress for 8 years now. Georgina  is married with 2 children. 

She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accomodation and utility bills. Georgina will use her loan to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase fabric to make dresses for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a baker. She bakes bread for sale at Aboadzi near Takoradi. She has been baking for 5 years now. She is married to a carpenter and has 3 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general up keep of their children. 

Regina will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her bakery. With the new profit from her expanded business she will buy one more oven to make her work easy.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is married and has 2 children, and her husband is a palm wine tapper. Hannah sells plantain at Aboadzi near Takoradi, which she has done for 3 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband to feed and pay their children’s school fees. 

Hannah will use her loan to buy more plantain to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more plantain to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Aboazi near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 4 years now. Cecilia is married   and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed, clothe and pay their children’s school fees.  

She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit, Cecilia plans to buld a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Aboazi near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 6 years now. Vivian is married   and has 4 children, and her husband is a teacher. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up keep of their home.  

Vivian will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit, Vivian plans to buld a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a food vendor. She cooks different kinds of food for sale. Some of the food she sells are rice, yam and banku. She serves her food with vegetable sauce, fried fish, and meat stew at Aboazi near Takoradi. She has been in this business for some years now. Alice is married and has 3 children, and her husband is a driver. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their children. 

Alice will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, maize, yams, meat, vegetables and other ingredients she will need to cook her food for sale. With the new profit, Alice plans to a acquire a place to serve her customers.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, maize, yams, meat, vegetables and other ingredients she needs to cook her food for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hairdresser, and has been for 4 years. She owns a beauty salon at Aboadzi near Takoradi. Mary is married, and she uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills.  

Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to acquire equipment to make work easy.

loans.use: purchase hair creams,  hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a dressmaker, and she makes dresses for sale  at  Aboadzi near Takoradi. She has been a seamstress for 5 years now. Comfort is married with 3 children, and she uses her income to support her husband to pay their accomodation and utility bills. 

Comfort will use her loan to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn is a married woman staying with her husband, who also helps her in her retail business. Amilyn believes that success comes from hardwork and with patience of the individual. She manages a retail shop where she sells different products in the community like canned goods, snack foods and drinks.

To have additional income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy a variety products that she can offer the people in her community.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy supplies to plant avocados.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: La nueva integrante del grupo es la joven Norma va a comprar con su prestamo pulseras, anillos, ropa y zapatos. La joven Norma tiene 23 años de edad, ella es soltera sin niños, ella vende ropa, zapatos y artículos de adorno para dama y niñas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar anillos, aretes, pulseras, collares, faldas, pantalones, blusas, zapatos de dama y caballero y una parte para pagar la luz y para comprar pintura. Ella inicio su negocio hace 2 meses con unos ahorros que tenia, ella sale a vender sus productos en la escuela secundaria y CBTIS, su negocio es importante porque le sirve de distracción y obtiene ganancias, a ella le gusta convivir con las personas, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio se siente contenta y se siente bien atendiendo a sus clienta las jóvenes, señoritas y señoras, ella utiliza las ganancia una parte para comprar ropa y zapatos y otra parte le da a su mama para el gasto para la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener su propia casa y vivir bien. Ella está contenta con este préstamo que le otorgaron le dan la oportunidad de crecer su negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su confianza con estos préstamos emprendemos un negocio o nos ayudan a crecer los negocios y a nuestras familias a progresar”.
texts.en:
The newest member of the group is Norma, a young lady who plans to use her loan to buy bracelets, rings, clothing and shoes.  Norma, 23, is single and has no children.  She sells clothing, shoes and women's and girl's accessories.  She is requesting a loan to buy rings, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, skirts, trousers, blouses, women's and men's clothing, and to use part of it to pay for electricity and to buy paint.  

She started her business two months ago with savings she had; and she sells her products and the high school and CBTIS.  Her business is important because it keeps her busy and provides an income.  She enjoys being around people and is proud to have her own business which allows her to attend to customers including girls and women of all ages.  She is using part of her income to buy clothing and shoes, and the other part goes to her mother to help pay for food.  Her goals for the future are to have her own house and lead a comfortable lifestyle.  She is grateful for the loan which will help her expand her business.  The members of the communal bank want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad,  "Thank you for the confidence in giving us these loans that help us in the our businesses so our families can get ahead".

loans.use: To buy rings, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, women's clothing and men's and women's shoes.

loans.name: Huepalcalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Huepalcalco, está conformado por la señora Rogelia va a comprar con su préstamo teleras, jamón, queso de puerco, la señora Ricarda va a comprar colchas, cobertores, perfumes y cosméticos de Avon, la señora Francisca va a comprar aguacate y durazno, la señora Carmela va a comprar jabón, azúcar, huevo, sopas, enlatados, la señora Carmen va a comprar carnes frías, chiles, jamón, mayonesa y verduras, la señora Brenda Lizbeth va a comprar jitomates, chiles, cebolla y frutas. La señora Carmen tiene 43 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, ella tiene 2 hijas una ya trabaja y la otra estudia para ingeniero. Ella vende regalos, tortas, lácteos, yogurt, gelatinas. Ella solicito su préstamo para comprar mercancía va a comprar peluches, lácteos, perfumes y juguetes, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años,  su esposo trabajaba en una cremería y le pagaban con mercancía, su negocio es importante porque le gusta atender a sus clientes bien, amablemente y le genera utilidad, ella se siente orgullosas de tener su propio negocio y ayudar en la economía de la familia, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprar los alimentos y para volver a invertir, ella está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir le dan la oportunidad de comprar nueva mercancía para regalos ya se viene la temporada del día de la mama, el día del maestro el día del niño. Sus sueños y esperanza son abrir puerta para su local de regalos para que tenga mejor vista y gracias a Dios y con mucho esfuerzo su hija está por terminar su carrera. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos nos ayudan a lograr nuestros sueños y que nos sigan ayudando con sus préstamos para crecer los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Huepalcalco" and its members are: Rogelia, who plans to use her loan to buy whole-wheat bread, jam, and pork cheese; Ricarda, who will buy bedspreads, coverlets, and Avon perfumes and cosmetics; Francisca, who will buy avocados and peaches; Carmela, who wants to buy soap, sugar, eggs, soups, and canned goods; Carmen, who plans to buy cold meats, chili peppers, ham, mayonnaise and vegetables; and Brenda Lizbeth, who will to buy tomatoes, chili peppers, onions and fruit.  

Carmen, 43, lives with her common-law husband and two daughters, one of whom works and the other is studying to be an engineer.  She sells gifts, cakes, dairy products, yoghurt and gelatin.  She has requested the loan to buy merchandise such as stuffed animals, dairy products, perfumes and toys.  She started her business 20 years ago.  Her husband works in a creamery and is paid in merchandise.  The business is important because she enjoys treating her customers well and with kindness, and earn an income.  She is pround to have her own business and be able to help the family economy.  She uses her profits to buy food and reinvest in her business.  The loan she is requesting will give her the opportunity to buy new gift merchandise for Mother's Day, followed by Teacher's Day and Children's Day.  Her goal is to open a shop window to display her goods, and through much effort and God's help, see her daughter finish her degree.  The members of the group want to express to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad: "Thanks for the loans that will help us meet our goals; and please continue granting the loans so we can grow our business and help our families".

loans.use: To buy stuffed animals, dairy products, perfumes and toys.

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama los pinos y se integra de  cuatro  señoras quien cada una se dedica a su  respectiva actividad  y vive en un pueblo llamado  coapilla en donde celebran la fiesta de la  santísima virgen de candelaria el 2 de febrero.
 
     Quien se  le tomo la entrevista se llama Flor de Luz quien es casada con  el señor Gilberto y con quien procreo tres hijos quienes dos están a su responsabilidad y una ya es independiente de si misma.

    Solicito el préstamo para  invertirlo en la compra de materiales  como  son: tintes, pinturas de unas, pegamentos para aplicar uñas acrílicas, entre otros para su estética en donde lleva trabajando  veintitrés años  un mes en la que comenta que le va bien.

      Inicio con esta actividad desde muy joven en donde  su  mama le pago unos cursos para que su  actividad sea un poco mejor y es así como ha estado  trabajando.

      Lo  que desea es que con el tiempo ella logre tener una estética amplia en la que su hija pueda trabajar ya que también está aprendiendo  lo  que es belleza.

       Las personas que integran en el grupo son:
    La señora: María de Jesús: quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra y venta de cosmético, marina  invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes y la señora Magdali  invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called "Los Pinos" and is comprised of four ladies who have their own businesses in the village of Coapilla, where the festivity of Our Lady of Candelaria is celebrated every February 2nd.

The person interviewed was Flor de Luz who is married to Gilberto, and they have three children, two of whom are still in their care.  Another daughter lives independently.

She has requested a loan to buy supplies such as hair color, nail polish, glue for acrylic nails and other beauty salon items.  She has been in business for 23 years and claims it is going well for her.  She started the business when she was very young and her mother paid for her to take courses to learn to do a good job, which is what she has been doing.

Over time she would like to expand her salon so her daughter can work there too, since she is studying in the beauty field.

The members of the group are:  María de Jesús, who will use her loan to buy and sell cosmetics; Marina, who will buy ingredients to make bread; and Magdali, who will buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
A woman with determination, Leticia is from the village of Cabisera 17-21 in the province of Isabela. Leticia is engaged in selling different products in the community.

To have additional income, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy different products that she can offer in the community. In the future, Leticia hopes that she can build her own store in front of their house.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, spices and food for her store

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: From the village of Cabisera 17-21, hardworking and diligent Rubelyn is married and manages her own store, selling a variety of products in the community.  Rubelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 24,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo and soap for her store to earn additional income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, shampoo and soap for her store.

loans.name: El Ayle Group

texts.es: Auscencio tiene 50 años de edad y es originario de una comunidad donde la principal actividad económica es el cultivo de flor de noche buena y el cultivo de aguacate ya que la tierra de ahí es muy prolifera para ese tipo de cultivos. Platica que desde hace mas de 12 años se dedica al cultivo de aguacate y dice que empezó este negocio por falta de un trabajo estable ya que como jornalero no pagan bien. Dice que gracias a que su padre le regalo un terreno el empezó a sembrar plantas de aguacate y que aunque es un negocio a largo plazo ahorita ya está viendo ganancias, dice que en temporada de cosecha que será por el mes de mayo el sale a vender el fruto a la central de abastos por cubetas para así ganarle un poco más. El está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos orgánicos para que no dañen la tierra. Don Auscencio está casado con la señora Petra ella se dedica hacer servilletas bordadas y tienen 3 hijos de nombres Sandra de 17 años la cual estudia la secundaria, Guadalupe de 6 años la cual desgraciadamente que al nacer le lastimaron la cadera y tiene que pagar terapias para que la niña pueda caminar y Alejandra de 3 años. La meta de don Auscencio es poder comprar otro terreno donde pueda sembrar mas plantas de aguacate y también empezar con el cultivo de flor de noche buena y comprar el armazón para hacer un vivero. Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Iván, Imelda y Julia ellos invertirán en el cultivo de aguacate y compraran insumos para tener las huertas de aguacate en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Auscencio is 50 years old and comes from a community whose principal economic activity is the cultivation of poinsettias and avocados, as the soil in the area is ideal for this type of crop. He tells us that for more than 12 years he has grown avocados and says that he started his business because there was a lack of stable work, and working as a day labourer does not pay well. Thanks to a gift of land from his father, he was able to begin planting avocados, and although this is a long-term investment, he is already seeing profits. He says that during the harvest season in May, he will go to sell his fruit by the bucket at the wholesale food market and earn a little more. He is asking for a loan to buy organic fertilisers which won't harm the land.

Auscencio is married to Petra, who works making embroidered napkins, and they have three children - Sandra, 17, who us studying at secondary school; Guadalupe, 6, who unfortunately suffered a hip injury at birth and needs therapy to be able to walk; and Alejandra, who is 3. Auscencio's goal is to buy another plot of land where he can plant more avocados and begin cultivating poinsettias, and also to buy a frame to build a nursery. The other three members of his group are called Iván, Imelda and Julia, who also wish to invest in cultivating avocados and buying supplies to keep their avocado farms in top condition.

loans.use: To buy supplies for cultivating avocado, like organic fertilisers and insecticides.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and married to Rogelio. They live in the San Juan province of Isabela. She is a very loving parent and does everything to make her family members' lives better. 

That's why Rosita manages a store—to provide additional income for the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan of 12000 PHP to buy spices, noodles and beverages for her store. She wishes that someday she can see her children have a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy spices, noodles and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 49 years old and already a widow. Her husband passed away in 2006 and she was left with their two children. Her daughter Cheryl is 21 years old and Maricris is 19 years old. They live in Barangay San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21), Ilagan, a rural and mountainous village.

Rosita manages a school canteen during school days and sells snacks in their village on weekends and during summer. She has been in this business for ten years and is still aiming to make it grow to save for her childrens' education and family needs.

She is requesting a loan for 27,000 PHP to improve her vending business by purchasing raw materials needed to make snacks and cook food to sell in the village. According to her, she could achieve her goals in life by being patient and industrious. She knows that God will remain by her side to guide her and her family in reaching their dreams in life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make snacks and cook food

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 59 years old. Elena is married with children. Elena owns and operates a livestock business, primarily rearing pigs for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever she sells an animal.

In 2010, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a very hardworking mother and loving spouse. She makes sure that she can provide the needs of her family. She manages a store in the community where she can sell different products. Aside from her store, her spouse is also engaged in a farming business.

To have additional products, Lilibeth is asking for a loan of 24,000 PHP to buy snack foods, canned goods and beverages for her store business. Lilibeth hopes that her business will expand so that she can give a quality living to her family.

loans.use: to buy snacks food, canned goods and beverages for her store

loans.name: Pentecostes Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Pentecostes esta conformado por las señorara Antonia, Aurelia, Irma, Brizaida y los señores Alberto y Javier todos solicitaron su prestamo para comprar abono organico e insecticida para el cultivo de nopal. La señora Brizaida tiene 23 años de edad ella, es casada su esposo trabaja en el cultivo de nopal ella tiene 1 hija pequeña de 2 años de edad, ella tiene su parcela de nopal, ella solicito su préstamo para comparar abono e insecticida para darle mantenimiento a su nopal, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años sus papas le enseñaron a trabajar en su localidad es una fuente de trabajo para la comunidad , su negocio es importante porque de ahí se alimenta la familia, a ella le gusta cuando ve que tiene mucha producción de nopal, los clientes llegan por el nopal en tráiler para exportarlo, ella utiliza las ganancias una parte para volver a invertir, otra para la alimentación y otra parte para los gasto de la casa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar un carro para utilizarlo en el trabajo y que su niña este bien creciendo sana. Ella está emocionada con el préstamo que va a recibir lo va a invertir en el cultivo de nopal. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad gracias por sus préstamos, les agradecemos la oportunidad de ayudarnos a crecer los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en: This united group is called Pentecostes. It is made up of Antonia, Aurelia, Irma, Brizaida and Alberto and Javier. All of them requested their loan to buy organic fertilizer and insecticide for their cactus crop. Brizaida is 23 years old, She is married. Her husband works farming cactus. She has one small daughter who is two years old. She has a lot of cactus. She requested her loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide to maintain her cactus. She began her business five years ago. Her parents taught her to work in her area which his a source of work for the community. Her business is important because, from it, she feeds the family.She likes it when she sees that she has a lot of cactus production. Customers arrive by trailer for the cactus to export it. She uses a part of the earnings to reinvest and the other part for food and another part for the bills at home. Her dreams and hopes are to buy a car to use for her work and that her daughter is well and grows healthy. She is emotional about the loan that she is going to receive. She is going to invest it in the cactus crop. The members of the group want to say to thank you to Kiva and to Fundacion Realidad for their loans. They are thankful for the opportunity to help themselves grow their business and families.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for their cactus crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to redecorate his restaurant's interior to create a cozy environment for the customer

loans.name: Granada Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Granada” está conformado por cinco mujeres y un hombre es un grupo que pertenece a la comunidad de Dolores Hidalgo una comunidad muy pequeña y tranquila siempre han sido un grupo muy unido y responsable con la institución.
Doña Elda quien es la representante de grupo nos cuenta que tiene 34 años de edad está viviendo en unión libre con el señor Víctor desde hace 4 años, juntos han formado una familia con dos niños que se encuentran estudiando uno en la primaria y otro en la secundaria.
Doña Elda se dedica a crianza y venta de pollos desde hace 14 años esta actividad, ella aprendió de su mamá, ya que cuando estaba esperando a su bebé ya no pudo trabajar y de alguna manera tenía que ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, también nos comenta que le gusta mucho ver a sus gallinas con sus pollitos pequeños en casa tiene 30 pollos entre gallinas pollos y pollitos. Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar mas pollos y alimento.
El reto más grande que presenta doña Elda es cuando sus pollos enferman y mueren también se le complica mucho comparar les vitaminas cada mes ya que es muy cara y muchas veces no tiene el recurso para gastar en las vitaminas para sus pollos.
En general todo el grupo tiene metas y creen que con el crédito podrán logar sus sueños, una de las metas de doña Elda es llegar a tener borregos, todos están muy agradecidos con el crédito porque les ha ayudado de mucho  porque con sus ganancias obtenidas han podido mejorar su calidad de vida por ejemplo comprando zapatos a sus hijos, ropa, comida etc. 
Esta vez doña Severiana comprara, alimento y medicamento para cerdos y borregos, don Isidro invertirá en alimento y maíz molido para pollos, doña Ofelia comprara zacate y alimento para borregos, doña Eulalia comprara alimento y medicamento para cerdos, doña Altagracia comprara alimento y medicamento para cerdos.
texts.en:
The “La Granada” group has five female and one male members. This group is in the community of Dolores Hidalgo. It is a very small and quiet community. The group has always been very united and responsible with the institution. 
Elda is the group’s representative. She is 34 years old and has lived with Victor, her common-law husband, for four years. Together, they have started a family and they have two children. One child is in primary school and one is in secondary school.
Elda has raised and sold chickens for 14 years. She learned these skills from her mother. When she was waiting for her baby and couldn’t work, she had to help her husband with the household expenses. She says that she loves to see the chickens with their little chicks. She has 30 chickens at her house with all of the chickens and chicks. This time, she has requested a loan to purchase more chickens and feed. 
The biggest challenge Elda faces is when her chickens become sick and die. It is also very difficult to purchase vitamins every month because they are expensive. Many times, she does not have the resources to spend money on vitamins for the chickens. 
In general, the whole group has goals and believe that with the loan, they can achieve their goals. One of Elda’s goals is to be able to have sheep. Everyone is very grateful for the loan because it has helped them a lot. With the profits, they have been able to improve their quality of life. For example, they can purchase shoes, clothing, food and other things for their children. 
This time, Severiana will purchase feed and medication for pigs and sheep. Isidro will invest in feed and ground corn for chickens. Ofelia will purchase feed for sheep. Eulalia will purchase food for pigs. Altagracia will purchase food and medication for pigs.

loans.use: purchase chickens and feed.

loans.name: Niyingabiye Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe Niyngabiye et habite à Gitega. Il a  63 ans et est marié à  Angele,   une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, l’aîné étudie à l’université et les deux autres à l’école secondaire.

Il fait le commerce de boissons (bière Primus, Amustel,…) dans son bistrot, depuis 27ans. 

Il est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de casiers de bière à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Daniel belongs to the Niyngabiye group and lives in Gitega. He is 63 years old and married to Angele, a farmer. They have three children together; the eldest is studying at university while the two others are at secondary school.
